A. 10, 396</bibl> (Ann. v. 463 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">digiti (of a hand cut off),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus (of a horse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">micuere fontes,</quote> <trans><tr>spring forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citatus vulnere angusto micat (cruor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 345" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina etiam sic undique micabant, ut peti viderentur corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>flashed in every direction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter horrendos fragores micare ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum micent gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ferocior inlatus hostis urgere scutis, micare gladiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 37, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29006.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29006.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To raise suddenly some of the fingers and let another instantly guess their number</hi>, which was practised both as a game of chance (called in Italy mora) and as a mode of deciding doubtful matters: <cit><quote lang="la">micare est sortiri digitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 347, 27</bibl></cit>: micandum erit cum Graeco, utrum ... an, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 347, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim sors est? item propemodum, quod micare, quod talos jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi sorte, aut micando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 23, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem et filium pro vita rogantes sortiri vel micare jussisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dignus est, quicum in tenebris mices, said of a thoroughly honest man, since it would be easy to cheat in the dark,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quo audacter posses in tenebris micare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44</bibl></cit>.—Also in contracts: RATIO DOCVIT, CONSVETVDINE MICANDI SVMMOTA, SVB EXAGIO POTIVS PECORA VENDERE, QVAM DIGITIS CONCLVDENTIBVS TRADERE, Edict. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3166</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29006.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of the <hi rend="ital">brilliancy</hi> of the stars, of the eyes, etc., <hi rend="ital">to flash, gleam, beam, shine, be bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">micat inter omnes Julium sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">micat ignibus aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 90</bibl></cit>. oculis micat ignis, <hi rend="ital">fire flashes from his eyes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oculis micat acrius ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">micant ardorem orbes luminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor circum caput omne micantes Deposuit radios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeri micuerunt nubila flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., twinkling, sparkling, glittering, gleaming, flashing, glowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella micans radiis Arcturus, Cic. Div. Poët. 2, 42, 110: micantes stellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 38, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos circumtulit igne micantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radius sole micantior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
micon: <entryFree id="n29007" type="greek" key="Mi^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭcon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/kwn</foreign>, <sense id="n29007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a shepherd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum me arbustum videre Miconis ... incidere falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramosa Micon vivacis cornua cervi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 30</bibl></cit>.—So, forte Micon senior, Canthusque Miconis alumnus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
microcosmus: <entryFree id="n29008" type="greek" key="micro^cosmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">micrŏcosmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mikro/kosmos</foreign>, <sense id="n29008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little world, world in miniature, microcosm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 22, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
micropsychus: <entryFree id="n29009" type="main" key="micropsy_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">micropsȳchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mikro/yuxos</foreign>, <sense id="n29009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little-minded, narrow-minded</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Novius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:87" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 87</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
microsphaerum: <entryFree id="n29010" type="main" key="microsphaerum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">microsphaerum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mikro/sfairon</foreign>, <sense id="n29010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small-leaved nard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mictilis: <entryFree id="n29011" type="hapax" key="micti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mictĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mingo</etym>, <sense id="n29011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that deserves to be defiled;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">despicable, worthless, bad</hi> (ante-class.): merx, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mictio: <entryFree id="n29012" type="main" key="micti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mictĭo</orth>, v. minctio.</entryFree>
mictorius: <entryFree id="n29013" type="main" key="micto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mictōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mingo</etym>, <sense id="n29013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that promotes urine, urinative, diuretic</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:86" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mictualis: <entryFree id="n29014" type="main" key="mictu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mictŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (only post <pb n="1143" /> <cb n="MIGR" /> class). <sense id="n29014.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to the passing of urine, wrinary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:91" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 5:10:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10, 121</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mictŭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the urinary passage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:65" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29014.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That promotes urine, diuretic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 117</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mictŭāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a diuretic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:122 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 122 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
micturio: <entryFree id="n29015" type="main" key="mictu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mictŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>4</itype>, <sense id="n29015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desider. n.</hi> [mingo], <hi rend="ital">to go to make water, to make water</hi> (only in Juvenal): <cit><quote lang="la">micturiunt hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:309" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 309</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:46" default="NO">16, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mictus: <entryFree id="n29016" type="main" key="mictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making water, urinating</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis mictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:3:59" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:1:12" default="NO">2, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
micula: <entryFree id="n29017" type="main" key="mi_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mica</etym>, <sense id="n29017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little crumb, little grain, little bit</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mida: <entryFree id="n29018" type="main" key="Mi^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Midas.</entryFree>
midaium: <entryFree id="n29019" type="main" key="Midaium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Midaium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mida/eion</foreign>, <sense id="n29019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 41, § 145</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Midaeenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Midaium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 3</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Midaei</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
midamus: <entryFree id="n29020" type="main" key="Mi_da_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīdāmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the fifty sons of Ægyptus, who was slain by his wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
midas: <entryFree id="n29021" type="main" key="Mi^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭdas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/das</foreign>, <sense id="n29021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Gordius, and king of Phrygia. At his request he received from Bacchus, who wished to prove his gratitude for the hospitality Midas had accorded him, the boon that everything he touched should turn to gold. But as this extended also to food and drink, he implored the assistance of the god. The latter told him to bathe in the river Pactolus, the sands of which from that time became mixed with gold. Midas decided in favor of Pan a musical contest between him and Apollo; who in revenge provided Midas with ass's ears</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:85 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 85 sq.</bibl> and 146; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 36, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:86:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 86, 4</bibl>.—Midas is said to have discovered the use of lead and tin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 274" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 274</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mide: <entryFree id="n29022" type="main" key="Mi_de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīdē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:331" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 331</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
midea: <entryFree id="n29023" type="main" key="Mi_dea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīdea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/deia</foreign>, <sense id="n29023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
midias: <entryFree id="n29024" type="main" key="Mi_di^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīdĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*meidias</foreign>, <sense id="n29024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Messenian, who invented the cuirass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
midinus: <entryFree id="n29025" type="main" key="Mi_di_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīdīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Midas</etym>, <sense id="n29025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Midas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcadicum ac Midinum sapis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after the manner of an ass</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 577</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
migdilybs: <entryFree id="n29026" type="greek" key="Migdi^lybs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Migdĭlybs</orth>, <itype>ybis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">migdhn-lu/y</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixed Libyan</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Libyan</hi> (African) <hi rend="ital">and Tyrian descent</hi>, as the Carthaginians were, Plaut Poen. 5, 2, 73.</sense></entryFree>
migma: <entryFree id="n29027" type="greek" key="migma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">migma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mi/gma</foreign>, <sense id="n29027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixture, mixed provender, meslin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commistum mig ma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 30, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
migratio: <entryFree id="n29028" type="main" key="mi_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mī^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>migro</etym>, <sense id="n29028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a removal, a changing of one's habitation, migration</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec migratio nobis misera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">migrationem esse mortem in eas oras, quas, qui vitā excesserunt, incolunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 8, 18</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n29028.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui verbo (fideliter) domicilium est proprium in officio, migrationes in alienum multae,</quote> <trans><tr>transfers, metaphorical uses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
migrator: <entryFree id="n29029" type="gloss" key="mi_^gra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mī^grātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wanderer</hi>: migrator <foreign lang="greek">metana/sths</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
migro: <entryFree id="n29030" type="main" key="mi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mī^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (migrassit for migraverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 11</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n29030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. root mā, exchange; also meo]. </sense><sense id="n29030.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to remove</hi> from one place to another, <hi rend="ital">to depart, flit, migrate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29030.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">migrare e fano foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex urbe tu rus habitatum migres?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad integra omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad generum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandriam vel Ilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 59</bibl></cit>: Verres domo ejus emigrat atque adeo exit: nam jam ante migrārat, <hi rend="ital">he quits his house</hi> (leaves it himself without taking any thing with him); <hi rend="ital">for he had already removed</hi> (had taken away his furniture), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36, § 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium migrandi a Tarquiniis cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque non solum inquilini, sed etiam mures migraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cb n="MILE" /> cum tota Karthagine migra, <hi rend="ital">be off!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:171" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 171</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alium quendam locum ex his locis morte migretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam inde frequenter migratum est a propinquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29030.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go away, depart, to pass over, change, turn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio ipse quid agam, neque mens officio migrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea ut migrare dicta possint, quo volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vitā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitis migravit ab aure voluptas ad oculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec medicina migrabat in Graeciae linguas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia migrant, Omnia commutat natura,</quote> <trans><tr>change</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 831</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerula quae sunt Numquam in marmoreum possunt migrare colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 774</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in varias migrare figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua in mucronem migrantia,</quote> <trans><tr>running out into, ending in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliud matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29030.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29030.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To carry away, transport, transfer</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cassita nidum migravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relicta quae migratu difficilia essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num migrantur Rhoeteia regna In Libyam Superis?</quote> <trans><tr>are transferred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:431" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 431</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29030.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To transgress, break, violate</hi>, opp. to servare: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile migrare (opp. conservare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea migrare et non servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mihipte: <entryFree id="n29031" type="main" key="mihipte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mihipte</orth>, i. q. mihi ipsi, v. ego.</entryFree>
milanion: <entryFree id="n29032" type="main" key="Mi_la^ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlănĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*meilani/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n29032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the husband of Atalanta</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flēsse Milaniona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mile: <entryFree id="n29033" type="main" key="mile"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mile</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mīlēsĭmus</orth>, etc., v. mille, millesimus, etc.</entryFree>
mileon: <entryFree id="n29034" type="main" key="mile^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">milĕon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n29034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plant, also called</hi> scelerata, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miles: <entryFree id="n29035" type="main" key="mi_le^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĕs</orth> (MEILES, Inscr. Mur. 582; late form, milex, Gromat. Vet. p. 246, 19), <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>Sanscr root mil-, to unite, combine; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mille, milites, quod trium millium primo legio fiebat, ac singulae tribus Titiensium, Ramnium, Lucerum milia singula militum mittebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 89</bibl></cit> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n29035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29035.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29035.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">miles, qui locum non tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 128</bibl></cit>: legere milites, <hi rend="ital">to levy, raise</hi>, Pompei, ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl> a, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <trans><tr>to enlist, enroll</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinare,</quote> <trans><tr>to form into companies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercede conducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hire, take into one's pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to dismiss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles tremulus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Priam</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:267" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles cum die, qui prodictus sit, aberat, neque excusatus erat, infrequens dabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29035.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of <hi rend="ital">foot-soldiers, infantry</hi>, in opp. to eques: <cit><quote lang="la">tripartito milites equitesque in expeditionem inisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: v. eques.—Opp. to the general: miles gregarius, or miles alone, <hi rend="ital">a common soldier, private</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenui militis et boni imperatoris officia simul exsequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl> volgus militum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 30, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritim as,</quote> <trans><tr>a soldier in sea-service, marine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29035.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29035.5" n="A" level="2"> Collect., <hi rend="ital">the soldiery, the army</hi> (esp. freq. in the postAug. per.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:78:2" default="NO">2, 78, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:18" default="NO">16, 18</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n29035.6" n="B" level="2"> Under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">an armed servant of the emperor, court-official</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 1, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29035.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A chessman, pawn</hi>, in the game of chess: <cit><quote lang="la">discolor ut recto grassetur limite miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 477</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29035.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, of a woman who is in childbed for the first time: <cit><quote lang="la">et rudis ad partūs et nova miles eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 48</bibl></cit>.—Of a nymph in the train of Diana: <cit><quote lang="la">miles erat Phoebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 415</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29035.9" n="E" level="2"> (Eccl. Lat.) Of a servant of God or of Christ, struggling against sin, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus Christi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
milesium: <entryFree id="n29036" type="hapax" key="mi_le_si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlēsĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n29036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of kingfisher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 8, 27, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
milesius: <entryFree id="n29037" type="main" key="Mi_le_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Miletus.</entryFree>
miletis: <entryFree id="n29038" type="main" key="Mi_le_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Miletus</etym>. <sense id="n29038.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of Miletus, Byblis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 634</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29038.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Milesian woman</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 378</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
miletopolis: <entryFree id="n29039" type="hapax" key="Mi_le_to^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlētŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*milhto/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n29039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in European Sarmatia, founded by the Milesians, otherwise called</hi> Olbia Borysthenis or Olbiopolis, now <hi rend="ital">Oczakow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miletus: <entryFree id="n29040" type="main" key="Mi_le_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/lhtos</foreign>, <sense id="n29040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Caunus and Byblis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 443</bibl>.— <cb n="MILI" /> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Miletus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 634</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29041" type="main" key="Mi_le_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tos</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/lhtos</foreign>, <sense id="n29041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city of Miletus, in Caria, the birthplace of Thales</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl>.—Esp., as a proverb for luxury and wantonness: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas Romana perit, hinc fluxit ad istos et Sybaris colles, hinc et Rhodos et Miletos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:296" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 296</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n29041.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*milh/sios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Miletus, Milesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milesia mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 16</bibl></cit>: deus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Apollo</hi>, who had a temple and oracle at Miletus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: carmina, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>—</sense><sense id="n29041.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n29041.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlēsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Miletus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter Milesiae conditorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29041.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlēsii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Miletus, Milesians, famous for their luxury and wantonness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39</bibl>. 9; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, transf.: Milesia carmina,</quote> <trans><tr>wanton, lascivious songs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:413" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo Milesius,</quote> <trans><tr>obscent stories</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; for which, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlēsĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number> (sc. fabulae), Sev. Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Albin. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29041.5" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mī-lētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Miletus, Milesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Miletida ad urbem, i. e. Tomi,</quote> <trans><tr>a colony of Milesians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mileum: <entryFree id="n29042" type="main" key="Mileum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mileum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Milevum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mi-levi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Don. 6:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> adv. Don. 6, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Milēvetānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Mileum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miliaceus: <entryFree id="n29043" type="hapax" key="mi^li^a^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭlĭăcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>milium</etym>, <sense id="n29043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of millet, millet</hi> puls, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. forma, p. 83, 12 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
miliacus: <entryFree id="n29044" type="main" key="mi^li^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fed with mil let</hi>: ficedulas, sive quas miliacas vocant, <hi rend="ital">millet-birds</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">ortolans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 27</bibl></sense></entryFree>
miliarensis: <entryFree id="n29045" type="main" key="mi_li^a_rensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭārensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">millĭārensis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mille</etym>, <sense id="n29045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that contains a thousand</hi> (post-class.): porticus, either <hi rend="ital">containing a thousand columns</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">containing a thousand paces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 49</bibl>: COHORS, Inscr. Marin. Frat. Arv. p. 630.</sense></entryFree>
miliarius: <entryFree id="n29046" type="main" key="mi_li_a_ri_us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlīārīus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">millĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comprising a thousand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29046.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=87" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 87</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivus,</quote> <trans><tr>of a thousand paces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apri,</quote> <trans><tr>weighing a thousand pounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 19, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ala,</quote> <trans><tr>of a thousand men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">COHORS, Inscr Grut. 482, 4: porticus,</quote> <trans><tr>a thousand feet in length</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: aevum, <hi rend="ital">of a thousand years</hi>, Tert Anim 31.—</sense><sense id="n29046.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n29046.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭārĭum (mill-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n29046.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mile-stone</hi> (which indicated a distance of a thousand paces, i. e. a Roman mile): <cit><quote lang="la">cum plebes prope ripam Anienis ad tertium miliarium consedisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra primum urbis Romae miliarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:104" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra centesimum urbis Romae miliarium,</quote> <trans><tr>within a hundred miles of Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—In partic.: miliarium or miliarium aureum, <hi rend="ital">the mile-stone set up by Augustus in the forum, as the terminal point of all military roads</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille passus non a miliario Urbis, sed a continentibus aedificiis numerandi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:154" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 27</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miliaria lapidea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 351:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 351, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29046.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman mile, a mile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29046.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The number one thousand, a thousand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 82</bibl> Müll.: annorum, <hi rend="ital">a space of a thousand years</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 7.—</sense><sense id="n29046.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭārĭi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mill-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Christian sect who believed in the doctrine of a millennial kingdom, the Millenarians, Chiliasts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Haeres. 8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Haeres. 8</bibl>; id. Civ. Dei, 20, 7, 1; Hier. praef. libri 18 in Isa. 66, 33.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29047" type="main" key="mi^li^a_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭlĭārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mill-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>milium</etym>, <sense id="n29047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to millet, millet-</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">miliariae (sc. aves) dictae a cibo, quod milio fiant pingues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 76</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <trans><tr>ortolans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>injurious to millet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 78, § 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29047.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭlĭārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mill-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a short and thick pillar which stood in the centre of the basin of an oil-mill to support the</hi> cupa, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29047.2" n="B" level="2"> In baths, <hi rend="ital">a tall and narrow vessel for drawing and warming water</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:24:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 24, 2</bibl>; Paul. <pb n="1144" /> <cb n="MILI" /> Sent. 3, 6, 65.—</sense><sense id="n29047.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cooking-vessel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miliarium argenteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
milichus: <entryFree id="n29048" type="main" key="Mi_li^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlĭchus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mīlicus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:104" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
milifolium: <entryFree id="n29049" type="main" key="mi_li^fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭfŏlĭum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">millefŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mille-folium</etym>, <sense id="n29049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, milfoil, yarrow;</hi> form milifolium: <cit><quote lang="la">myriophyllus, quod nostri milifolium vocant, caulis est tener, similis feniculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 95, § 152</bibl></cit> Jan. (al. millefolium); <cit><quote lang="la">used in medicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:176 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 19, 116, § 176 al.</bibl></cit>—Form millefolium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 19, § 42</bibl> Jan. (al. millefolia).</sense></entryFree>
miliginus: <entryFree id="n29050" type="main" key="mi_li^gi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭgĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>milium</etym>, <sense id="n29050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of millet</hi> (late Lat.), Dynam. 1, 14.</sense></entryFree>
milio: <entryFree id="n29051" type="main" key="mi_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for milvus, <sense id="n29051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kite</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
milionia: <entryFree id="n29052" type="main" key="Milioni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Milionĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Italy, in the country of the Marsians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes">34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
militarie: <entryFree id="n29053" type="main" key="mi_li^ta_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭtārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. militarius <sense id="n29053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
militaris: <entryFree id="n29054" type="main" key="mi_lita_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlitāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>miles</etym>, <sense id="n29054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a soldier, to war</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to military service, proper to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">usual with soldiers, military, warlike, martial</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">militares pueri,</quote> <trans><tr>soldiers' children, officers' sons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 45, 2</bibl></cit>.— Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭtāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a military man, soldier, warrior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur neque militaris Inter aequales equitat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia militarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 33</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <trans><tr>military ensigns, standards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 32, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire militaribus gradibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to march</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: aetas, <hi rend="ital">the age for bearing arms</hi> (from the seventeenth to the forty-sixth year), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>a military road, a highway on which an army can march</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15</bibl></cit>: herba, <hi rend="ital">an herb good for wounds, also called</hi> millefolium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 18, 104, § 168</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">an appellation of Jupiter</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 75.—In <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis justior et militarior Scipione?</quote> <trans><tr>more militarily strict</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭtārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a soldierly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">military manner</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:4:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 4, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
militarius: <entryFree id="n29055" type="main" key="mi_li^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldierlike, military</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭtārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a soldier-like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">military manner</hi> (postclass.): militarie caesus, Treb. Trig. Tyrann. 22 dub.</sense></entryFree>
militia: <entryFree id="n29056" type="main" key="mi_li^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (-āi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 29</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">military service, warfare, war.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29056.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in militiae disciplinam profectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiam subterfugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus militiae sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae vacatio,</quote> <trans><tr>exemption from military service</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae magna scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiam discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus Graecos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentas militias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:82" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cimbrica Teutonicaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae honorem,</quote> <trans><tr>military honors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29056.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n29056.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> militiā, <hi rend="ital">in war</hi>, opp. togā, in peace, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29056.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> militiae, <hi rend="ital">in military service</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">on a campaign, in the field;</hi> freq. in phrase: domi militiaeque, <hi rend="ital">at home and abroad, at home and with the army</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum virtus fuerat domi militiaeque cognita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et domi et militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae domique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae et domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 5, 49</bibl></cit>.—Also without domi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29056.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of love: <cit><quote lang="la">at confidentia militia illa militatur multo magis quam pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of an inattentive lover: pro infrequente eum mittat militiā domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29056.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29056.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Military spirit, courage, bravery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virilis militiae uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29056.8" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the soldiery, military</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites, exercitus, copiae): hic pars militiae, dux erat ille ducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanae militiae decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omni militiā interficitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 27, § 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua (lex) maxima apud eos vis cogendae militiae erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: magister militiae, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, id. <cb n="MILL" /> 22, 23, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—So trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">militia caeli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the heavenly bodies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 7, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 17, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29056.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A civil service, office, profession, employment</hi>, esp. a laborious one: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc urbanam militiam respondendi, scribendi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mea militia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of swallows building their nests: <cit><quote lang="la">eaque militia illis cum anno redit semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29056.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any special work of difficulty, requiring a great effort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">completa est militia ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma militiae nostrae non carnalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Tim. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29056.11" n="E" level="2"> Under the emperors (like miles), <hi rend="ital">an office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">employment at court</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
militiola: <entryFree id="n29057" type="hapax" key="mi_li^ti^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭtĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>militia</etym>, <sense id="n29057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short, insignificant term of military service</hi>: semestribus militiolis tumens, Suet. Vit. Juv</sense></entryFree>
milito: <entryFree id="n29058" type="main" key="mi_li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>miles</etym>, <sense id="n29058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a soldier, to perform military service, to serve as a soldier</hi> (syn.: stipendium mereo; class.). </sense><sense id="n29058.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cujus exercitu Catonis filius tiro militabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub signis alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Persas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobiscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inter vigiles Romae Sex annis militaverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29058.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29058.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make war, wage war, war against; pass.</hi>, with a homogeneous subject: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter hoc et omne militabitur Bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29058.4" n="2" level="3"> Of other than military service: <cit><quote lang="la">at confidentia militia illa militatur multo magis quam pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixi puellis nuper idoneus, Et militavi non sine gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima stipendia Veneri militabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 226, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militat in silvis catulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—Of an inanim. subject: <cit><quote lang="la">aries machina est, quae muros frangere militat,</quote> <trans><tr>serves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carnalia desideria, quae militant adversus animam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 11.</sense></entryFree>
milium: <entryFree id="n29059" type="main" key="mi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n29059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">millet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 304</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:100" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 10, 24, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mille: <entryFree id="n29060" type="main" key="mille"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mille</orth>, in the <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlia</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">millia</orth>; <sense id="n29060.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">archaic, MEILIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3308</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> milli, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 16</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 5</bibl>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root mil-, combine, associate; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(/milos</foreign>; cf. miles</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a thousand, thousands</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29060.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29060.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., sometimes in <hi rend="ital">sing. subst</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.; in plur</hi>, only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: equites mille viā breviore praemissi, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille et quingentis passibus abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille drachumarum Olympicūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spondeo et mille auri Philippum dotis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mille nummūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille denariūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille quingentos aeris in censum adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 40</bibl></cit>: ibi occiditur mille hominum, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum mille versabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 20, 53</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">verb</hi> in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: plus mille et centum annorum est, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: passuum, Cato ap. Gell. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 5 al.</bibl>; cf. Zumpt, Gr. § 116.—In <number>plur.</number> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracum mille aut duo milia occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexcenta milia mundorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 96</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censa sunt civium capita centum quadraginta tria milia septingenta quatuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittarios tria milia numero habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot milia, gentes Arma ferunt Italae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem milia talenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Evang. Matt. 18, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatuor milia, funditores et sagittarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 40, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 38, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 58, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritici modios CXX milia polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecis peditibus mercede conductis, triginta milibus, praepositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:21" default="NO">9, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:41" default="NO">5, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 52, 7</bibl>.—Distributively: <cit><quote lang="la">in milia aeris asses singulos,</quote> <trans><tr>on every thousand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29060.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: mille passus, mille passuum, or simply mille, <hi rend="ital">a thousand paces</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a Roman mile</hi>, which is estimated at 1618 English yards, or 142 yards less than the English statute mile: milli passum dixit (sc. Lucilius) pro mille passibus ... aperteque ostendit mille et vocabulum<cb n="MILO" />  esse et singulari numero dici, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:16:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 16, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra quadringenta milia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: mille passuum mora, <hi rend="ital">a mile's delay</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a long delay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mille passuum commoratu's cantharum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29060.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">muri/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a thousand</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">innumerable, infinite</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mille pro uno Kaesones exstitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 28, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille trahens varios adverso sole colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentat mille modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille pericula saevae urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:46" default="NO">12, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo persequatur unus mille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 32, 30</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante milia annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14 praef.</bibl></cit> 1, § 3: milia tumulorum, Prud. cont. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:516" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 516</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat numerus eorum milia milium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mille alia, alia mille,</quote> <trans><tr>innumerable others</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
millefolia: <entryFree id="n29061" type="spur" key="mille^fo^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĕfŏlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, false read. for milifolium, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 19, § 42</bibl>.</entryFree>
millefolium: <entryFree id="n29062" type="main" key="mille^fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĕfŏlĭum</orth>, v. milifolium.</entryFree>
milleformis: <entryFree id="n29063" type="main" key="mille^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĕformis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">millĭformis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mille-forma</etym>, <sense id="n29063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a thousand forms</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
millenarius: <entryFree id="n29064" type="main" key="mille_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>milleni</etym>, <sense id="n29064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a thousand, millenary</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 7: aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Anim. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux lanceariorum,</quote> <trans><tr>commander of a thousand</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
