milleni: <entryFree id="n29065" type="main" key="mille_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n29065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. num. distr.</hi> [mille], <hi rend="ital">a thousand each, a thousand</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for mille numero is the true reading,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit>), Gal. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:89:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 89, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 21, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Esdr. 8, 27.</sense></entryFree>
millepeda: <entryFree id="n29066" type="main" key="mille^pe^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĕpĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mille-pes</etym>, <sense id="n29066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thousandfeet</hi>, an insect, perh. <hi rend="ital">the wood-louse, milleped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29066.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A hairy caterpillar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
millesimus: <entryFree id="n29067" type="main" key="mille_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millēsĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lensimus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mille</etym>, <sense id="n29067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thousandth</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">millesimam partem vix intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in millesimo corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter mille rates tua sit millesima puppis, i. e. ultima, Ov H. 13, 97: usura,</quote> <trans><tr>one for every thousand monthly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 100</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">armillam, ex millesimis Mercurii factam,</quote> <trans><tr>the thousandth part of gain vowed to Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">millēsĭmum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the thousandth time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q pater quartum vel potius millesi mum nihii sapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
milliarensis: <entryFree id="n29068" type="main" key="milli^a_rensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĭārensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. miliarensis.</entryFree>
milliarius: <entryFree id="n29069" type="main" key="milli^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. miliarius.</entryFree>
millies: <entryFree id="n29070" type="main" key="milli^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīlĭes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">milliens</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mi-liens</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thousand times</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quinquies millies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel et tricies millies mille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Innumerable times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moreretur prius millies quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera juris millies mutata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">millies melius,</quote> <trans><tr>a thousand times better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus miliens audivi,</quote> <trans><tr>more than a thousand times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
milliformis: <entryFree id="n29071" type="main" key="milli^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. milleformis.</entryFree>
millimodus: <entryFree id="n29072" type="main" key="milli^mo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĭmŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mille-modus</etym>, <sense id="n29072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thousand-fold, innumerable</hi> (postclass.): irae, Ven. Vit. S. Martin. 3, 303.</sense></entryFree>
millio: <entryFree id="n29073" type="hapax" key="milli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hawk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Emp. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
millus: <entryFree id="n29074" type="main" key="millus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">millus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. mellum.</entryFree>
milo: <entryFree id="n29075" type="main" key="Mi^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭlo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭlon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/lwn</foreign>. <sense id="n29075.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated athlete of Crotona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9 praef.</bibl> § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29075.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Pisa, in Elis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:327" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 327</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29076" type="main" key="Mi^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name assumed by T. Annius, as an admirer of Milo of Crotona, and the leader of a band of gladiators. He was the son of C. Papius Celsus and Annia, daughter of C. Annius, who adopted the grandson. He was tribune of the people with Clodius</hi>, B. C. 57, <hi rend="ital">but afterwards killed the latter, and was defended by Cicero in an oration still extant</hi> (pro T. Annio Milone).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭlōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> T. Annius Milo, <hi rend="ital">Milonian</hi>: tempora, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the time when Milo was indicted</hi>, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, B, 2.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭlōnĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (sc. oratio), <hi rend="ital">the oration of Cicero for Milo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 526</bibl>. <pb n="1145" /> <cb n="MIMM" /></sense></entryFree>
milonius: <entryFree id="n29077" type="main" key="Mi_lo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīlōnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a parasite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miltiades: <entryFree id="n29078" type="main" key="Miltia^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Miltiădes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*miltia/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n29078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the celebrated general of the Athenians, the victor in the battle of Marathon</hi>, Nep. Milt.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 67, 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miltiteslapis: <entryFree id="n29079" type="greek" key="milti_tes la^pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miltītes lăpis</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">milti/ths li/qos</foreign>, <sense id="n29079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of blood-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 20, 38, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miltos: <entryFree id="n29080" type="greek" key="miltos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miltos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">miltos</foreign>, <sense id="n29080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red-lead, minium</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">native cinnabar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 38, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
milua: <entryFree id="n29081" type="main" key="milu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">milŭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-va</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>milvus</etym>, <sense id="n29081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a she-kite</hi>, as a term of abuse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miluago: <entryFree id="n29082" type="main" key="milu^a_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">milŭāgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vago</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, = milvus, II. A., <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 6, 36</bibl> (but a false read for lolligo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 6, § 15</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
miluinus: <entryFree id="n29083" type="main" key="milu^i_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">milŭīnus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">milvīnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the kite</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29083.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">resembling a kite, kite-like</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rapacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a thief's clutches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 63</bibl></cit>. pullus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>: miluinus pes, <hi rend="ital">kite's foot</hi>, an herb so called from its resemblance to the foot of a kite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:section=1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 7, § 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 35, § 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29083.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">miluīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">milvīna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> * </sense><sense id="n29083.3" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. fames.) <hi rend="ital">A kite's</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a ravenous, appetite, voracity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 29</bibl> (dub.; Ritschl, bulimam).—</sense><sense id="n29083.4" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. tibia.) <hi rend="ital">A kind of flute of a very clear tone</hi>: miluina genus tibiae acutissimi soni, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miluus: <entryFree id="n29084" type="main" key="miluus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miluus</orth> (later also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">milvus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird of prey, a kite, glede</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29084.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmentum ei deripuit miluos ... postulare ut sibi liceret miluom vadarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 10, 12, § 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miluo est quoddam bellum quasi naturale cum corvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulteretur et columba miluo, of something impossible,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:32" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 32</bibl></cit>.—Of rapacious men, <hi rend="ital">a kite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male ego metuo miluos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dives arat Curibus, quantum non milvus oberret,</quote> <trans><tr>so large that a kite could not fly across it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:26" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>; Juv 9, 55; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 37, 8</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n29084.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29084.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fish of prey, a gurnard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(metuit) opertum miluus hamum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:95" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29084.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A constellation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella Lycaoniam vergit proclivis ad Arcton Miluus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:794" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 794</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
milvius: <entryFree id="n29085" type="main" key="Milvi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Milvĭus Pons</orth>, v. Mulvius.</entryFree>
milyadum: <entryFree id="n29086" type="hapax" key="Mily^a^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Milyădum Commūne</orth>, <sense id="n29086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district and city in Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 95</bibl>; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Milyas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mima: <entryFree id="n29087" type="main" key="mi_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (in the <case>dat.</case> and <sense id="n29087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi>, mimabus, acc. to Cledonius, p. 1863 P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mimus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a female mimic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2624</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">a mima uxore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mimallones: <entryFree id="n29088" type="main" key="Mi^mallo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭmallŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mima/llones</foreign>, <sense id="n29088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bacchantes</hi> (poet), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:660" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 660</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> C. 1, 13</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29088.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭmallŏnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Bacchantic, Bacchanalian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:99" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29088.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭmallŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Bacchante</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 541</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mimarius: <entryFree id="n29089" type="main" key="mi_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mimus</etym>, for mimicus, <sense id="n29089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mime, mimic</hi> (post-class.): mimarii scurrae, Capitol Ver. 8, 1.—</sense><sense id="n29089.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a mimic actor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2631</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mimas: <entryFree id="n29090" type="main" key="Mi^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭmas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/mas</foreign>. <sense id="n29090.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain range in Ionia, opposite the Isle of Chios, a branch of Mount Tmolus, still called Mimas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 118</bibl>; Ov M. 2, 222; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl>, a, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:page=580" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. p. 580</bibl> Orell.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 14, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29090.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A giant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Typhoeus et validus Mimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:278" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 278</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29090.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mimanta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 702</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mimiambi: <entryFree id="n29091" type="main" key="mi_mi^ambi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmĭambi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mimic poem in iambics, mimic iambics</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> de Metr. p. 2437</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mimice: <entryFree id="n29092" type="main" key="mi_mi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mimicus <sense id="n29092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mimicus: <entryFree id="n29093" type="greek" key="mi_mi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mimiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mimes, mimic, farcical</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29093.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aut scurrilis jocus sit, aut mimicus,</quote> <trans><tr>farcical, extravagant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 47</bibl> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n29093.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res mimicae et ineptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <trans><tr>mimic, feigned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 94 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a mime, farcically</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:12:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mimmulus: <entryFree id="n29094" type="main" key="mimmu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mimmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plant</hi>, <cb n="MINA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 259</bibl> dub. (Sillig, nummulus).</sense></entryFree>
mimnermia: <entryFree id="n29095" type="gloss" key="Mimnermi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mimnermĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Venus</hi>: alii Venerem Mimnermiam vel Meminiam dicunt, quod meminerit omnium, Serv Aen. 1, 720.</sense></entryFree>
mimnermus: <entryFree id="n29096" type="main" key="Mimnermus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mimnermus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/mnermos</foreign>, <sense id="n29096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek elegiac poet of Colophon, the inventor of the pentameter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mimnermi versus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>elegiac poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mimographus: <entryFree id="n29097" type="greek" key="mi_mo^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mimogra/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n29097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a composer of mimes, a mimographer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2622</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:186" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mimologus: <entryFree id="n29098" type="greek" key="mi_mo^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mimolo/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n29098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an actor in mimic plays</hi> or <hi rend="ital">farces, a mime</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 8.</sense></entryFree>
mimula: <entryFree id="n29099" type="main" key="mi_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mima</etym>, <sense id="n29099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little mime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mimulus: <entryFree id="n29100" type="main" key="mi_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mimus</etym>, <sense id="n29100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little mime</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
mimus: <entryFree id="n29101" type="greek" key="mi_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mi=mos</foreign>. <sense id="n29101.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mimic actor, mime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratori minime convenit distortus vultus gestusque: quae in mimis rideri solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 501</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:198" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 198</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29101.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mimic play, mime, farce</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29101.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimi exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor, mimus vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimos scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:497" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimorum scriptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimos commentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimum agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimus quis melior plorante gula?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29101.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing farcical, pretended, unreal</hi>.—Of the sham triumph of Caligula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commendationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimus et simulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 26:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
min: <entryFree id="n29102" type="main" key="min" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">min</orth>, <itype>for minium</itype>, v. h. v.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n29103" type="main" key="min'" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">min'</orth>, <itype>for mihine</itype>, v. ego.</entryFree>
mina: <entryFree id="n29104" type="greek" key="mi^na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭna</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">mna</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 107</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mna=</foreign>. <sense id="n29104.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek weight of a hundred Attic drachmas, a mina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 34, 109, § 185</bibl>; Rhem. Fann. de Ponder. 32 sq. —</sense><sense id="n29104.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek money of account</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29104.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The silver mina;</hi> this was of 100 Attic drachmae or Roman denarii (about $18.05 of our currency): <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 8 al.</bibl>—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 22 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae bonae mala opera partae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29104.3" n="B" level="2"> Auri, <hi rend="ital">the mina of gold</hi>, of five times the value of the silver one: <cit><quote lang="la">alia opust auri mina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29105" type="main" key="mi^na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n29105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., smooth</hi>: mina ovis, <hi rend="ital">smooth-bellied, with no wool on the belly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mina (id est ventre glabro), Varr R. R. 2, 2, 6: minae oves, a play on the double meaning of the word (v. 1. mina, II.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29105.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: minam Aelius vocitatam ait mammam alteram lacte deficientem, quasi minorem factam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=122" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 122</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
minabiliter: <entryFree id="n29106" type="gloss" key="mi^na_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. minor</etym>, <sense id="n29106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threateningly</hi>: minabiliter, <foreign lang="greek">a)peilhtikw=s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
minaciae: <entryFree id="n29107" type="hapax" key="mi^na_ci^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnācĭae</orth>, <itype>arum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>minae</etym>, <sense id="n29107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">menaces, threats</hi>, with a play upon the double meaning of minae; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 1. mina: at ego oves et lanam et alia multa quae poscet dabo. Meliust te minis certare mecum quam minaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:55 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 55 sq.</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 22</bibl>, the true reading is minae).</sense></entryFree>
minaciter: <entryFree id="n29108" type="main" key="mi^na_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. minax <sense id="n29108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
minae: <entryFree id="n29109" type="main" key="mi^nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root min-, only in Lat.; cf.: mentum, minari, and perh. mons</etym>, <sense id="n29109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the projecting points</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pinnacles</hi> of walls (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n29109.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae murorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 6, 11</bibl>; 20, 6, 2.—</sense><sense id="n29109.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">threats, menaces</hi>, of animate and inanimate things (class.). </sense><sense id="n29109.3" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem hercle Aeacidinis minis animisque expletus cedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem hominibus instituendo et persuadendo, non minis et vi ac metu tradi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 247</bibl></cit>: terrēre minis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 261): <cit><quote lang="la">minas jactare,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw out threats</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 36</bibl></cit>. —Of the threats used by cattle-drivers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 56</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a bull: nullae in <cb n="MINE" /> fronte minae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 857</bibl>; of a snake: tol lentemque minas, <hi rend="ital">raising threats</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">raising himself in a threatening posture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 421</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29109.4" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aspice, quam saevas increpat aura minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentes parturit ira minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestes minae territabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">forebodings of misfortune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:342" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 342</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minaei: <entryFree id="n29110" type="main" key="Minaei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Minaei</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Minnaei</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia, celebrated for their myrrh and frankincense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 155</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 888</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnae-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Minæi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 16, 35, § 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minanter: <entryFree id="n29111" type="main" key="mi^nanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. minor <sense id="n29111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
minatio: <entryFree id="n29112" type="main" key="mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. minor</etym>, <sense id="n29112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threatening, threat, menace</hi>, as an action (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae illaec est minatio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 288</bibl></cit>: imperiosis minationibus confutare, Tullius Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 3, 13 Hertz.</sense></entryFree>
minator: <entryFree id="n29113" type="main" key="mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who drives cattle with threats, a cattle-driver, a drover</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
minatorius: <entryFree id="n29114" type="main" key="mi^na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>minator</etym>, <sense id="n29114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threatening</hi> (post-class.): sonitu minatoric (al. minaci), Amm 17, 7, 14.</sense></entryFree>
minax: <entryFree id="n29115" type="main" key="mi^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. minor</etym>, lit., <sense id="n29115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jutting out, projecting</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29115.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">minaci Pendentem scopulo,</quote> <trans><tr>overhanging, projecting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur saxi,</quote> <trans><tr>overlying, incumbent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 881</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29115.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">threatening, menacing, full of threats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">menaces</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29115.3" n="A" level="2"> Of living things: <cit><quote lang="la">Indutiomarus iste minax atque arrogans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 12, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituli nondum metuenda fronte minaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus barbaros minacissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29115.4" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor saevum minaxque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentia minacior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit> litterae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <trans><tr>significant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 52</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">threateningly, menacingly, with threats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">menaces</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios minaciter terrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minacius dicere quam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 8, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minciades: <entryFree id="n29116" type="main" key="Minci^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mincĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Mincius</etym>, <sense id="n29116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Minciade</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Virgil</hi>, as born in Mantua, on the Mincius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mincius: <entryFree id="n29117" type="main" key="Minci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mincĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Cisalpine Gaul, which runs by Mantua, a tributary of the Po</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mincio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minctio: <entryFree id="n29118" type="main" key="mincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">minctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mingo</etym>, <sense id="n29118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making water</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minctura: <entryFree id="n29119" type="main" key="minctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">minctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making water</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 33</bibl> (al. mictura).</sense></entryFree>
minctus: <entryFree id="n29120" type="main" key="minctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">minctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (late Lat.), Cael. Aur. signif 136.</entryFree>
mineo: <entryFree id="n29121" type="spur" key="mi^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, false reading for meant</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 563</bibl> and 1193; v. Lachm. ad h. l.</entryFree>
minerrimus: <entryFree id="n29122" type="gloss" key="minerri^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">minerrĭmus</orth>, <itype>pro minimo dixerunt</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=122" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 122</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
minerva: <entryFree id="n29123" type="main" key="Mi^nerva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnerva</orth> (old orthogr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Menerva</orth>, <itype>like magester, leber</itype>, etc., acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 17</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from the root men, whence mens, memini, moneo, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr></etym>, <sense id="n29123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman goddess, identified with the Grecian Pallas Athene, the daughter of Zeus, and the goddess of wisdom, of sense and reflection, of the arts and sciences, of poetry, and of spinning and weaving</hi>: Minerva dicta, quod bene moneat. Hanc enim pagani pro sapientiā ponebant; Cornificius vero, quod fingatur pingaturque minitans armis, eandem dictam putat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:180" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 180</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 74</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">daedala, Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. daedalam, p. 68: Minerva nostra, custos urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva Iliensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles ... Minervam esse Lunam probabilibus argumentis demonstrat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: pingui or crassā Minervā aliquid facere, <hi rend="ital">without art, skill</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">learning, plainly, rudely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl> § 33; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus crassā Minervā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitā Minervā,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to the bent of one's genius or natural abilities, against the grain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 385</bibl></cit>: quia nihil <pb n="1146" /> <cb n="MINI" /> decet invitā, ut aiunt, Minervā, id est adversante et repugnante naturā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:301" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 301</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus Minervam (docet),</quote> <trans><tr>a stupid man will instruct a wise one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis Minervae homo,</quote> <trans><tr>jack - of - alltrades</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 8</bibl></cit>: MINERVA MEDICA, i. e. medicina, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of health</hi>, Inscr Rein. 11, 81: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit ex ebore aeque Minervam,</quote> <trans><tr>a statue of Minerva</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 54</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29123.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A working in wool, spinning and weaving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerare colo vitam tenuique Minervā ( = telā, lanificio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 409</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29123.2" n="B" level="2"> To form the name of a place. </sense><sense id="n29123.3" n="1" level="3"> Minervae Arx, v. Minervius, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n29123.4" n="2" level="3"> Minervae Promontorium, <hi rend="ital">a promontory in Campania, to the south-east of</hi> Surrentum, <hi rend="ital">the abode of the Sirens</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Punta della Capanella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 709</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minerval: <entryFree id="n29124" type="main" key="Mi^nerval"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnerval</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Minerva</etym>, <sense id="n29124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gift in return for instruction</hi> (ante- and postclass.), Varr R. R. 3, 2, 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minervalicium: <entryFree id="n29125" type="gloss" key="Mi^nerva_li^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnervālĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Minerval</etym>, perh. for Minerval, <sense id="n29125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teacher's fee</hi>: Minervalicium, <foreign lang="greek">sustatiko/n</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
minervalis: <entryFree id="n29126" type="main" key="Mi^nerva_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnervālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Minerva</etym>, <sense id="n29126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Minerva</hi> (to learning, good sense, etc.), <hi rend="ital">Minervan</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. ad Ephes. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MAGISTER,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2421</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnervālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">festivities in honor of Minerva</hi>, Sergius, p. 1846 P</sense></entryFree>
minervinus: <entryFree id="n29127" type="gloss" key="Minervi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Minervīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Minervius</etym>, <sense id="n29127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman slave</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 479, 1.</sense></entryFree>
minervius: <entryFree id="n29128" type="main" key="Mi^nervi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnervĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Minerva</etym>, <sense id="n29128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Minerva, Minervian</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Minerva</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 137</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">LEGIO,</quote> <trans><tr>named after Minerva</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 922</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1767</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1894</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cives, i. e. Athenienses, because there was in Athens a temple of Minerva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 175</bibl></cit>: versus, <hi rend="ital">verses composed in honor of Minerva</hi>, Paul. ex Fest. s. v axamenta, p. 3 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n29128.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnervĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n29128.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A temple of Minerva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 47</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 193</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29128.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A city and castle</hi> (hence also called Arx Minervae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 531</bibl>) <hi rend="ital">in Calabria, south of Otranto, the primitive seat of the Salentines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mineus: <entryFree id="n29129" type="main" key="mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>minium</etym>, <sense id="n29129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a cinnabar-red color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color rosarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 2, p. 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 2, p. 348</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mingo: <entryFree id="n29130" type="main" key="mingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mingo</orth>, <itype>inxi, inctum and ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root mig, whence also meio; cf. also the Greek <foreign lang="greek">o) mixe/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make water, to void urine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in me veniant mictum atque cacatum, Hor S 1, 8, 38: urina mingitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>: ut quantum bibisset, tantum mingeret, Vop ap Bon. 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 107</bibl>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miniaceus: <entryFree id="n29131" type="main" key="mi^ni^a_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>minium</etym>, <sense id="n29131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of cinnabar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">minium, cinnabar-red, vermilion</hi> (only in Vitr.): <cit><quote lang="la">expolitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: minatius (i. e. miniaceus), <foreign lang="greek">miltwdhs</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</sense></entryFree>
minianus: <entryFree id="n29132" type="main" key="mi^ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painted with red-lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cinnabar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minianus Juppiter (i. e. statua Iovis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miniarius: <entryFree id="n29133" type="main" key="mi^ni^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to minium</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cinnabar</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">miniarium metallum,</quote> <trans><tr>a cinnabar mine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29133.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭā-rĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cinnabar mine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miniatulus: <entryFree id="n29134" type="hapax" key="mi^ni^a_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [miniatus], <hi rend="ital">colored with red-lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cinnabar, colored red</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miniatus: <entryFree id="n29135" type="main" key="mi^ni^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. <itype>minio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
minicularius: <entryFree id="n29136" type="main" key="mi^ni^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. minuscularius.</entryFree>
minime: <entryFree id="n29137" type="main" key="mi^ni^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. parvus <sense id="n29137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, under minimus.</sense></entryFree>
minimopere: <entryFree id="n29138" type="main" key="mi^ni^mo^pe^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭmŏpĕre</orth>, i. e. minimo opere, <sense id="n29138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not at all</hi>, Licin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minimus: <entryFree id="n29139" type="main" key="mi^ni^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. parvus <sense id="n29139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mininus: <entryFree id="n29140" type="main" key="mi^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mina</etym>, <sense id="n29140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">costing a mina, of the worth of a mina</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 95</bibl></cit> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
minio: <entryFree id="n29141" type="main" key="mi^ni^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n29141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>minium</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to color with red-lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cinnabar, to paint red</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 38, § 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:157" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 12, 45, § 157</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n29141.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Colored with red-lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cinnabar, colored red, red</hi>: quae quidem, vereor,<cb n="MINI" />  ne miniata cerula tua pluribus locis notandae sint, <hi rend="ital">with your red-lead pencil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29141.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the color of cinnabar, cinnabar-red</hi>, of the parrot: <cit><quote lang="la">avis torque miniato in cervicem distincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 58, § 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29142" type="main" key="Mi^ni^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n29142.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small river in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mignone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minionis in arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> 1, 279</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29142.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the river Minio</hi>, Mela, 2, 4, 9.</sense></entryFree>
miniscitur: <entryFree id="n29143" type="gloss" key="mi^nisci^tur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭniscĭtur</orth>, <itype>pro reminiscitur antiquitus dicebatur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=122" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 122</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
minister: <entryFree id="n29144" type="main" key="mi^nister"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnister</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n29144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> ministrūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 86</bibl>) [a double <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> in form, from minus and <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> ending -ter, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ter-os</foreign>; cf.: magister, sinister], <hi rend="ital">that is at hand, that serves, ministers</hi> (as an adj. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and later): lumina (i. e. oculi) propositi facta ministra tui, <hi rend="ital">that further, promote; promotive</hi>, or in a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minister Grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:274" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministro baculo,</quote> <trans><tr>with the aid of a staff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:261" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29144.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n29144.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnister</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant, waiter, servant;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">a priest's attendant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assistant;</hi> likewise <hi rend="ital">an inferior officer, underofficial;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">an aider</hi> in a good or bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a furtherer, promoter, helper, an abettor, accomplice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum aliae (famulae), totidemque pares aetate ministri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygius,</quote> <trans><tr>the cup-bearer Ganymede</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:691" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 691</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:15:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falerni,</quote> <trans><tr>a cup -bearer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri publici Martis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia Inter cunctantes cecidit moribunda ministros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri imperii tui,</quote> <trans><tr>inferior officers, under-officials</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <trans><tr>an assistant in the regal government, a minister</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infimi homines ministros se praebent in judiciis oratoribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inform the orators what the law is</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 45, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <trans><tr>a minister, administrator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonum,</quote> <trans><tr>a mediator, negotiator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius Alexander ... minister bello datus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri ac servi seditionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri ac satellites cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 3, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">furoris alieni,</quote> <trans><tr>agents, instruments</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis, Cic Lael. 10, 35: socii scelerum atque ministri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calchante ministro,</quote> <trans><tr>with the help of Calchas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministrum esse in maleficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minister fulminis ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the eagle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidae gelidaeque (aquae) minister,</quote> <trans><tr>one who serves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nemo ministro fur erit,</quote> <trans><tr>by my aid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—Esp. (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a minister of religion, a preacher of Christ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sim minister Christi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 15, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:26" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 26</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">sit anulus tuus non minister alienae voluntatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedae, ardore ministro, suppeditant novum lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 297</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29144.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female attendant, maid-servant; a female assistant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">minister</hi>, at religious worship (class. only in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n29144.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">una ministrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">306</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 705</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipiat missas apta ministra notas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara deae certe tremuit, pariente ministrā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Vestal Sylvia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 47</bibl></cit>.—Also among Christians: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillae, quae ministrae dicebantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deaconesses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29144.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a servant, handmaid;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">an aider, accessory, abettor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministra et famula corporis res familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum satellites et ministrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camilla delegit pacisque bonas bellique ministras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 658</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ministerialis: <entryFree id="n29145" type="main" key="mi^niste^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistĕrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ministerium</etym>, <sense id="n29145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ministering</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Orig. Princip. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistĕrĭāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">imperial officers</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 7, 5 al.</sense></entryFree>
ministeriani: <entryFree id="n29146" type="main" key="mi^niste^ri^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistĕrĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = ministeriales, <sense id="n29146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperial officers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">rubric</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
ministeriarius: <entryFree id="n29147" type="gloss" key="mi^niste^ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistĕrĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ministerium</etym>, <sense id="n29147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to service, serviceable</hi>: ministeriarius, <foreign lang="greek">u(phretiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Phil.</sense></entryFree>
ministerium: <entryFree id="n29148" type="main" key="mi^niste^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>minister</etym>, <sense id="n29148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">functions of a</hi> minister, <hi rend="ital">attendance, service, ministry</hi>, in a good or bad sense; <hi rend="ital">an office, occupation, work, labor, employment, administration</hi>, etc. (not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf.: munus, officium). </sense><sense id="n29148.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sunt <cb n="MINI" /> qui ita distinguant: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam beneficia esse, quaedam officia, quaedam ministeria: beneficium esse, quod alienus det: officium esse filii, uxoris, etc.: ministerium esse servi, quem conditio sua eo loco posuit, ut nihil eorum, quae praestat, imputet superiori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 10</bibl></cit>. ubi ego omnibus parvis magnisque ministeriis praefulcior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 6</bibl>: facere uxoribus, <hi rend="ital">to wait</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attend upon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 32, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assuetos ministeriis talium facinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis necessarium quam speciosi ministerii procurationem intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2</bibl></cit>. 51: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerium consilii sui afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 223</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">foeda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 619</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirinus acribus ministeriis consulatum adeptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministeria belli,</quote> <trans><tr>military service</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerio Catonis ... facta provincia Cyprus est,</quote> <trans><tr>agency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:38:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: ministeris functi esse, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 13, 3, 2.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the Christian ministry, the office of a preacher of Christ</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of religion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reconciliationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29148.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n29148.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A suite of attendants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quindecim convivarum, ac ministerii capax triclinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministeria magistratibus conscribere, i. e. lictores, viatores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulicum,</quote> <trans><tr>court-servants</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atratum coquinae ministerium,</quote> <trans><tr>the kitchen-servants</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varia arenae ministeria,</quote> <trans><tr>managers of the games</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29148.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A service of dishes, table-service</hi> (post-class.): ducentarum librarum argenti pondus ministerium, Lampr Alex. Sev. 34; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ministra: <entryFree id="n29149" type="main" key="mi^nistra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. minister, II. B.</entryFree>
ministratio: <entryFree id="n29150" type="main" key="mi^nistra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ministro</etym>, <sense id="n29150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">service, assistance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
