ministrator: <entryFree id="n29151" type="main" key="mi^nistra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attendant, waiter, servant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(turbam) transeo ministratorum, per quos, signo dato, ad inferendam cenam discurritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum dominicum ministratoris gratia est,</quote> <trans><tr>cup-bearer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:203" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">MERCVRIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensos ministratores, Cato esse scribit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 18</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum auriganti Caio ministratorem exhiberet,</quote> <trans><tr>play the assistant, the instructor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te ipsum, Sulpici, objurgabam, quod ministratorem peteres, non adversarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ministrator, aderat, subiciens, quid dicerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ministratorius: <entryFree id="n29152" type="main" key="mi^nistra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ministrator</etym>, <sense id="n29152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an attendant, servant</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">urceoli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:105" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 105</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
ministratrix: <entryFree id="n29153" type="hapax" key="mi^nistra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistrātrix</orth>, <itype>icis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, for ministra, <sense id="n29153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female attendant, a handmaid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministratrices oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 75</bibl></cit> dub. (Orell. ministras; v. Orell. ad loc.; and cf. minister, II. B. 2.).</sense></entryFree>
ministrix: <entryFree id="n29154" type="gloss" key="mi^nistrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ministra</etym>, for ministra, <sense id="n29154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maid-servant, handmaid</hi>: ministrix, <foreign lang="greek">u(phre/tis</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ministro: <entryFree id="n29155" type="main" key="mi^nistro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnistro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>minister</etym>, <sense id="n29155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to attend, wait upon, serve</hi>, esp. at table, <hi rend="ital">to serve up, pour out, hand</hi> food or drink (syn.: servio, appareo, praebeo, suggero; class.). </sense><sense id="n29155.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29155.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acastum retine, quo commodius tibi ministretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui matronam ministrasse compererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29155.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosmet inter nos ministremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29155.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ministrabit dum ego edam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29155.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take care of, manage, govern, direct;</hi> and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to provide, furnish, supply, give, afford</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministrare (naves) velis, of the steersman,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves nec velis ministrantur, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministrare victum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros et arma alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolem,</quote> <trans><tr>to give, present, produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministrabant ei de facultatibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces furiis Clodianis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus terga ministrat (for mounting),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:216" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa medicorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to execute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 133</bibl></cit>.—Also of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentum colibus sucum ministrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: (vinum) verba ministrat, Hor. <pb n="1147" /> <cb n="MINO" /> Ep. 1, 15, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">luna ministrat equis,</quote> <trans><tr>serves them, lights them on their way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges ministrabunt tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:60:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 60, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:20:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 20, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minitabiliter: <entryFree id="n29156" type="main" key="mi^ni^ta_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭtābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>minitor</etym>, <sense id="n29156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threateningly</hi> (ante-class.): increpare, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 22</bibl>; Att. ib.</sense></entryFree>
minitabundus: <entryFree id="n29157" type="main" key="mi^ni^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threatening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rex ... circumdari ignes minitabundus juberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minitatio: <entryFree id="n29158" type="main" key="mi^ni^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threatening</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. Phaen. 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 24, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minito: <entryFree id="n29159" type="main" key="mi^ni^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. minitor <sense id="n29159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
minitor: <entryFree id="n29160" type="main" key="mi^ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n29160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> minitarier for minitari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">minito</orth>, āre; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. freq.</hi> [1. minor], <hi rend="ital">to threaten, menace</hi> a person with any thing; constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui aliquid, alicui aliquā re</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29160.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mihin' malum minitare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista horribilia minitare purpuratis tuis!</quote>  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratri mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgas securesque omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facito istud quod minitaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin consul arma minetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis illest qui minitatur filio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29160.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic urbi ferro ignique minitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 14, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 21, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic urbi ferro flammāque minitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit> (Klotz, ferrum flammamque): <cit><quote lang="la">Caesari gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: qui ferro minitere, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. ningulus, p. 177 Müll. (Ann. v. 133 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n29160.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunc minitare facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29160.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ergo minitaris tibi te vitam esse amissurum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam, carnufex, Minitare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli minitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae minitas mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 85</bibl></cit>: etiam minitas? Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid minitabas te facturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Fragm. ib. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0094,001:Tr. 17" default="NO"><author>Liv. Andron.</author> Tr. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minium: <entryFree id="n29161" type="foreign" key="mi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (apoc. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">min</orth>, Verg. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Gram. 9</bibl>) [Span.], <sense id="n29161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">native cinnabar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hiberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29161.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Red-lead, minium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minius: <entryFree id="n29162" type="main" key="mi^ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>minium</etym>, <sense id="n29162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of cinnabar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">minium, cinnabar-red, vermilion</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">rosarum minius color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 2, p. 348, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29163" type="main" key="Mi^ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Lusitania</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Minho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 21, 35, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mino: <entryFree id="n29164" type="main" key="mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, collat. form of minor (ante-class., acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl>, but v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 563</bibl>.—From the application of the words minari and minae to the threatening cries of cattledrivers is doubtless derived the old rustic signif., also generally adopted in the postclass. per. into the literary lang.), <sense id="n29164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> animals: <cit><quote lang="la">asinos et equum minantes baculis exigunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 216: <cit><quote lang="la">me ut suam juvencam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 67, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregem ad interiora deserti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: per omnem mundum (so, vaccam), Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:526" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 526</bibl>: agasones equos agentes, id est minantes, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. agasones, p. 25 Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a validis ventis minentur (naves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Nah. 2, 7</bibl>.—Of men: <cit><quote lang="la">eos a tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 18, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence the Ital. <hi rend="ital">menare;</hi> Fl. <hi rend="ital">mener</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
minois: <entryFree id="n29165" type="main" key="Mi_no_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīnōis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*minwi=(s</foreign>. <sense id="n29165.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female descendant of Minos</hi>. So <hi rend="ital">his daughter Ariadne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex magis, an regnum Minoida sollicitat?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pasiphaë, the wife of Minos</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29165.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name of the Isle of Paros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minoius: <entryFree id="n29166" type="main" key="Mi_no_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīnōĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*minw/i+os</foreign>, <sense id="n29166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Minos, Minoan;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also for <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minoia regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: virgo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ariadne, daughter of Minos</hi>, Val. <cb n="MINO" /> Fl. 7, 279: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <trans><tr>the tribunal of Minos in the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:11:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cretan arrows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:107" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans><tr>Cretan army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta Brundisii,</quote> <trans><tr>founded by Cretans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 406</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minor: <entryFree id="n29167" type="main" key="mi^nor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n29167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form, v. mino) [minae], <hi rend="ital">to jut forth, project.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29167.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">geminique minantur In caelum scopuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa minantia caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29167.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to threaten, menace</hi> one with any thing; constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui, alicui aliquid</hi>, with <case>abl.</case>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">ne.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29167.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.). </sense><sense id="n29167.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 149</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n29167.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crucem minari alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29167.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepit minari interdum ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29167.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac minatus sese abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor se patientiam debilitaturum minatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 75</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor interminorque, nequis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit> Fleck. —</sense><sense id="n29167.8" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">cum domus mea ardore suo deflagrationem Urbi minabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra populo minantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:256" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (ornus) usque minatur, et tremefacta comam concusso vertice nutat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>threatens to fall, gives signs of falling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil color caeli minatur, Juv 14, 294: quodcumque minabitur arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 350</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29167.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)peilei=n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to promise boastfully</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">atqui vultus erat multa et praeclara minantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui magna cum minaris, extricas nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., threateningly, with threats</hi>, = minaciter: <cit><quote lang="la">multa minanter agat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 582</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29168" type="main" key="mi^nor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnor</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, <sense id="n29168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">less, smaller inferior</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, from parvus, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
minoratio: <entryFree id="n29169" type="main" key="mi^no_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>nis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>minor</etym>, <sense id="n29169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diminution, abasement</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 20, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minoro: <entryFree id="n29170" type="main" key="mi^no_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnōro</orth>, no <sense id="n29170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. minor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make smaller, less</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fewer, to lessen, diminish</hi> (eccl. Lat.), perit anima, ei minoratur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:106:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 106, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies temporis ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et qui minoratur viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eccli. 41, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29170.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be lacking, be in want</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et qui modicam, non minoravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 8, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., diminished, less</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">minorato pretio vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 7, 10</bibl></cit> (al. numerato).</sense></entryFree>
minos: <entryFree id="n29171" type="main" key="Mi_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīnos</orth>, <itype>ōis</itype> (ōnis: Minonis ira, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 710</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/nws</foreign>. <sense id="n29171.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Zeus and Europa, brother of Rhadamanthus, king and lawgiver in Crete, and after death a judge in the infernal regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eos venire, qui vere judices appellentur, Minoëm, Rhadamanthum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 436</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Minoa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 440</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 367</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29171.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The grandson of the former, likewise king in Crete, the husband of Pasiphaë, father of Ariadne, Phædra, Androgeos, and Deucalion, and builder of the labyrinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 456</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 6</bibl> sq.; 152; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minotaurus: <entryFree id="n29172" type="main" key="Mi_no_taurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīnōtaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*minw/tauros</foreign>, <sense id="n29172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a monster with the head of a bull and the body of a man, the fruit of the intercourse of Pasiphaë, the wife of Minos, with a bull. Minos caused him to be shut up in the labyrinth and fed with human flesh. The Athenians were obliged to deliver to him seven boys and as many maidens every year, until Theseus destroyed him, and, with the aid of Ariadne's clew, escaped from the labyrinth</hi>: Minotaurus putatur esse genitus, cum Pasiphaë Minois regis uxor dicitur concubuisse cum tauro. Sed affirmant alii, Taurum fuisse nomen adulteri, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=148" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 148</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">proles biformis Minotaurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 456</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 152</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 41" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 41</bibl>: Minotauri effigies inter signa militaria est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=148" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 148</bibl> Müll.—Comically: offensione Minotauri, <orth extent="full" lang="la">i. e</orth>. Calvisii et Tauri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minous: <entryFree id="n29173" type="main" key="Mi_no_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīnōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Minos</etym>, <sense id="n29173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Minos, Minoan;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also for <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minoa venundata Scylla figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit> (19), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">Pasiphaë,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the wife of Minos</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thoas,</quote> <trans><tr>the son of Ariadne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <trans><tr>the shores of Crete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:511" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 511</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MINU" /></sense></entryFree>
mintha: <entryFree id="n29174" type="greek" key="mintha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mintha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">minthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mi/nqh</foreign>, <sense id="n29174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek name for</hi> menta, <hi rend="ital">mint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentae nomen suavitas odoris apud Graecos mutavit, cum alioqui mintha vocaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 47, § 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mintrio: <entryFree id="n29175" type="main" key="mintri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mintrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mintro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, of the sound made by a mouse, <sense id="n29175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to squeak</hi>: mus avidus mintrit (al. mintrat), Auct. Carm. Philom. 61.</sense></entryFree>
minturnae: <entryFree id="n29176" type="main" key="Minturnae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Minturnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Latium, on the border of Campania, at the mouth of the Liris, in the neighborhood of which Marius concealed himself from Sylla in a marsh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:2" default="NO">8, 2, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29176.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Minturnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Minturnæ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>written at Minturnæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Liris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Minturnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Minturnæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minucia: <entryFree id="n29177" type="main" key="Mi^nu^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnŭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Minucius.</entryFree>
minucius: <entryFree id="n29178" type="main" key="Mi^nu^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnŭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Minut-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnŭ-tĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Minuc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <hi rend="ital">of whom</hi>, </sense><sense id="n29178.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Minucius Rufus, magister equitum <hi rend="ital">under the dictator</hi> Fabius Maximus Cunctator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:386" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 386</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29178.2" n="2" level="3"> Another, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29178.3" n="3" level="3"> Minucius Felix, <hi rend="ital">of Africa, in the third century of the Christian era, the author of an apologetic work in favor of the Christian religion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnŭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a vestal, who was punished for incontinence by being buried alive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29178.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnŭcĭ-us</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Minut-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Minucius, Minucian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minucia gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. osi, p. 201 Müll.: Minucia porta appellata est eo, quod proxima esset sacello Minucii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 147</bibl></cit> Müll.: porticus, <hi rend="ital">in Rome, built by</hi> M. Minucius Rufus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>from Rome to Brundisium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minuisco: <entryFree id="n29179" type="hapax" key="mi^nu^isco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnŭisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>minuo</etym>, <sense id="n29179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow less, to diminish</hi>, Aus. Ephem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> dub.</sense></entryFree>
minume: <entryFree id="n29180" type="main" key="mi^nu^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnŭmē</orth>, <itype>for minime</itype>, v. parum.</entryFree>
minumus: <entryFree id="n29181" type="main" key="mi^nu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnŭmus</orth>, <itype>for minimus</itype>, v. parvus.</entryFree>
minuo: <entryFree id="n29182" type="main" key="mi^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. mi, lessen, change; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">minu/w, minu/qw</foreign>; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">mei/wn</foreign> = minor; Germ. minder, vermindern</etym>. <sense id="n29182.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to make smaller, to lessen, diminish;</hi> lit. and trop. </sense><sense id="n29182.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ramaliaque arida tecto Detulit, et minuit,</quote> <trans><tr>broke in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <trans><tr>to chop into small pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:647" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portarum objectus,</quote> <trans><tr>to dash in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes in limine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to let blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same signif., simply minuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29182.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lessen, diminish, lower, reduce, weaken, abate, restrict</hi> (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperium matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rem familiarem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestias vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuuntur corporis artus,</quote> <trans><tr>grow less, diminish in size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuuntur corpora siccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 54, 118, § 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul alter proelio uno et vulnere suo minutus,</quote> <trans><tr>discouraged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 52, 2</bibl></cit> (al. deminutus): <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem profectionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversias,</quote> <trans><tr>to settle, put an end to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuenda est haec opinio,</quote> <trans><tr>to be refuted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum, censuram,</quote> <trans><tr>to restrict the power of, to limit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem populi Romani per vim,</quote> <trans><tr>to violate, offend against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tu ea causa minueris Haec quae facis, ne is mutet suam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <trans><tr>to alter, change</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condemnationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to commute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:224" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:57" default="NO">4, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29182.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to diminish, grow less</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuente aestu,</quote> <trans><tr>at the ebbing of the tide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuente lunā,</quote> <trans><tr>waning</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 243</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crescentis minuentisque sideris species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (diminished; hence), <hi rend="ital">little, small, minute</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29182.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pueri minuti (opp. majores), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 141, 18</bibl>: id <pb n="1148" /> <cb n="MINU" /> omnes magni minutique, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 45</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuta ac brevia folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 24, 53, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 835</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opuscula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere minuto qualiacumque somnia vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:546" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies minutae,</quote> <trans><tr>miniature portraits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:291" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 291</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutior ac mage pollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 318</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutissimis ictibus excarnificatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>little things, trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res minutissimae et contemptibiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:35:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29182.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">petty, paltry, insignificant</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29182.6" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">alii minuti et angusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:256" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29182.7" n="2" level="3"> Of things: canto carmina versibus minutis, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuti est animi voluptas ultio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:189" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 189</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the smallest piece of money, a mite, farthing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 12, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aes minutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29182.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The little</hi> (opp. longa), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:7" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29182.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Minutes, points, very small parts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 2</bibl>; Gram. Vet. p. 374, 11.—</sense><sense id="n29182.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa minutiora,</quote> <trans><tr>those less important matters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 48:18" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 48, 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n29182.11" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">into small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fine pieces, finely, minutely</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29182.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal minute tritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutissime commolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia minutissime scripta,</quote> <trans><tr>in an extremely small hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29182.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29182.14" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In a petty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">paltry manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res minutius tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29182.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Minutely, closely, accurately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutius et scrupulosius scrutantur omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29182.16" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">into small pieces, finely, minutely</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">concidere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scoria minutim fracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 51, § 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29182.17" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">With short steps, trippingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus ambulans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deambulare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 53, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minurio: <entryFree id="n29183" type="main" key="mi^nu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūrĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnurrio</orth>, <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">minuri/zw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to twitter, to chirp, to coo</hi>, said of singing birds (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">palumbes minurriunt (al. minarriunt),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prognem inter asseres minurientem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
minurritiones: <entryFree id="n29184" type="gloss" key="mi^nurri_ti^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnurrītĭōnes</orth> <itype>appellantur avium minorum cantus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=122" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 122</bibl> Müll.; cf. minurio.</entryFree>
minus: <entryFree id="n29185" type="main" key="mi^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnus</orth>, <sense id="n29185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">less.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29185.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj. comp.</hi>, from minor; v. parvus.—</sense><sense id="n29185.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, v. parvus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n29186" type="main" key="mi^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. mina.</entryFree>
minuscularius: <entryFree id="n29187" type="main" key="mi^nuscu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnuscŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>minusculus</etym>, <sense id="n29187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small, petty, paltry, trifling</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">minuscularii aquaeductus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 42, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 55, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29187.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnuscŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a collector of small taxes</hi>, in detail, opp. to the receiver-general, Cod. Th. 11, 28, 3 (al. minicularii); cf. in full: minuscularii vectigalium conductores (al. minutularii in the same sense), Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 4.</sense></entryFree>
minusculus: <entryFree id="n29188" type="main" key="mi^nuscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. minus], <hi rend="ital">rather less, rather small</hi> (class.): ostium, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>very short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of persons: meretrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minutal: <entryFree id="n29189" type="main" key="mi^nu_tal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>minutus</etym>. <sense id="n29189.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dish of minced meat</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:129" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29189.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnū-tālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">petty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">paltry things, trifles</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culices, formicae, tineae et hoc genus minutalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minutalis: <entryFree id="n29190" type="main" key="mi^nu_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small, paltry, insignificant</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an insignificant author</hi>: ceteri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the other writers of no consequence</hi>, Hier. Ep. ad Ephes. prooem.</sense></entryFree>
minutatim: <entryFree id="n29191" type="main" key="mi^nu_ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">piecemeal, in little bits; piece by piece, little by little; gradually, by degrees; singly, one by one</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nasturtium consectum minutatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrare terram,</quote> <trans><tr>to sift small</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 15, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in little questions, by bits, always adding something</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid addere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: assuefaciant, Varr. <cb n="MIRA" /> R. R. 1, 20, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se recipere, Auct. B. Afr. 31: cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulos convenire,</quote> <trans><tr>one by one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minute: <entryFree id="n29192" type="main" key="mi^nu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. minuo, <sense id="n29192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
minutia: <entryFree id="n29193" type="main" key="mi^nu_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>minutus</etym>, <sense id="n29193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smallness, fineness, minuteness</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">donec ad minutiam redigantur,</quote> <trans><tr>to make quite small, reduce to powder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 23</bibl></cit>: pulveris minutiae, <hi rend="ital">little particles</hi>, Lact. Ira Dei, 10, 9.—<hi rend="ital">Plur., insignificant matters, trifles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praetereamus negotiorum minutias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilium minutias indagare causarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiam producere per ignobiles minutias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: per minutias, <hi rend="ital">into the minutest detail;</hi> with scrutari, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 25</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with demonstrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gesta narrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—Postclass. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam minutiem conterere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 263; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 256</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minutiloquium: <entryFree id="n29194" type="main" key="mi^nu_ti^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtĭ-lŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>minutus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n29194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brevity of speech</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Aristotelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 6</bibl></cit>; Boëth. Myth. 1 praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
minutim: <entryFree id="n29195" type="main" key="mi^nu_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. minuo, <sense id="n29195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
minutio: <entryFree id="n29196" type="main" key="mi^nu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>minuo</etym>, <sense id="n29196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lessening, diminishing</hi> (post-Aug.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop., opp. incrementum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis, i. e. deminutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:5" default="NO">4, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <trans><tr>blood-letting, bleeding</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">minutio alone: cum praescriptis minutionis observantiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minutius: <entryFree id="n29197" type="main" key="Mi^nu_ti^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnūtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Minucius.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29198" type="main" key="mi^nu_ti^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtĭus</orth>, <sense id="n29198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, v. minutus and minute.</sense></entryFree>
minutivus: <entryFree id="n29199" type="main" key="mi^nu_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>minuo</etym>, <sense id="n29199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adapted for diminution, diminishing</hi>, opp. auctivus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Art. Rhet. 3, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minutularius: <entryFree id="n29200" type="main" key="mi^nu_tu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtŭlārĭus</orth>, v. minuscularius.</entryFree>
minutulus: <entryFree id="n29201" type="main" key="mi^nu_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [minutus], <hi rend="ital">very little; very paltry</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenteos Philippeos minutulos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minutus: <entryFree id="n29202" type="main" key="mi^nu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. minuo <sense id="n29202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
minyae: <entryFree id="n29203" type="main" key="Mi^ny^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnyae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*minu/ai</foreign>, <sense id="n29203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Minyans, Argonauts, the companions of Jason, so called from their ancestor Minyas, a king in Thessaly</hi>: Minyae dicti Argonautae, quod plerique eorum ex filiis Minyae fuerant orti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=122" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 122</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minyanthes: <entryFree id="n29204" type="greek" key="minyanthes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">minyanthes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">minuanqe/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of large-leaved clover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 30, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:152" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 21, 88, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minyas: <entryFree id="n29205" type="main" key="Mi^ny^as1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnyas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Minyae.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29206" type="main" key="minyas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">minyas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem (Pythagoras) minyada appellat, nomine alio Corinthiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 100, § 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minyeias: <entryFree id="n29207" type="main" key="Mi^ny_e_i^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnȳēĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*minuhi+a/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Minyas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
minyeides: <entryFree id="n29208" type="main" key="Mi^ny^e_i^de^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnyēĭdĕs</orth>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnēĭdĕs</orth>), = <foreign lang="greek">*minuhi/+des</foreign>, <sense id="n29208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughters of Minyas, who were changed into bats for slighting the festival of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 32</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Minyeïdăs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:425" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 425</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minyeius: <entryFree id="n29209" type="main" key="Mi^ny^e_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnyēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*minuh/i+os</foreign>, <sense id="n29209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Minyas</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Minyeia proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 389</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
minyeus: <entryFree id="n29210" type="hapax" key="Mi^ny^e_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭnyēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭny-īus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*minuei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n29210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old name of the river Orchomenos, in Thessaly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orchomenus, Minyius antea dictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mio: <entryFree id="n29211" type="gloss" key="mi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <sense id="n29211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make water</hi>, Inscr. Zaccaria, Marm. Salonit. p. 10, n. 15.</sense></entryFree>
mirabiliarius: <entryFree id="n29212" type="main" key="mi_ra_bi^li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrābĭlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mirabilis</etym>, <sense id="n29212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wonder-worker, worker of miracles</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mirabilis: <entryFree id="n29213" type="main" key="mi_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrābĭlis</orth> (<sense id="n29213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> mirabilissimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:36:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 36, 3</bibl> MSS.), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>miror</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be wondered at, wonderful, marvellous, extraordinary, admirable, strange, singular</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nimium mirimodis mirabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec hoc tam re est, quam dictu inopinatum atque mirabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnandi cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tibi sit potius quam tu mirabilis illi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetis Phrygibus mirabile sumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 73</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ista majora ac mirabiliora fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 74</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="MIRI" /> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilissima soboles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:36:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 36, 3</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n29213.1" n="(a)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: mirabile est, with a <hi rend="ital">subjectclause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29213.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam, quantum, quomodo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabile est, quam non multum differat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esset mirabile quomodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabile quantum gaudebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:620" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 620</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29213.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With latter <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: (mirabile dictu) truditur e sicco radix oleagina ligno, <hi rend="ital">wonderful to tell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to be told</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 30</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29213.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp. (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n29213.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Glorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilis Deus in sanctis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:67:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 67, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilis in altis Dominus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 92, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29213.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Miraculous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilia opera Altissimi solius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 5, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29213.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrābĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a miracle, wondrous deed</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">et faciet Dominus mirabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—Mostly <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras faciet Dominus inter vos mirabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videntes mirabilia quae fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 21, 15</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n29213.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wonderfully, astonishingly, marvellously, extraordinarily, surprisingly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mirabiliter vulgi mutata est voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moratus est,</quote> <trans><tr>is strangely constituted, is a strange fellow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonabit Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 37, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilius augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mirabilitas: <entryFree id="n29214" type="main" key="mi_ra_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mirabilis</etym>, <sense id="n29214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wonderfulness, admirableness, admirable quality</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">operum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
mirabiliter: <entryFree id="n29215" type="main" key="mi_ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mirabilis <sense id="n29215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mirabundus: <entryFree id="n29216" type="main" key="mi_ra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>miror</etym>, <sense id="n29216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wondering, astonished, full of wonder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">astonishment</hi> (mostly Livian and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nova res mirabundam plebem convertit, quidnam incidisset, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poeni mirabundi, unde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 37, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 26</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabundi bestiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miracidion: <entryFree id="n29217" type="gloss" key="miracidi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miracidĭon</orth>, <itype>primae adulescentiae</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
miracula: <entryFree id="n29218" type="main" key="mi_ra_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrācŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>miror</etym>, <sense id="n29218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marvellously ugly woman</hi> (ante-class.): diobolares, miraculae, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 64</bibl> Müll.: miraculae a miris, id est, monstris, Varr. ib.</sense></entryFree>
miraculum: <entryFree id="n29219" type="main" key="mi_ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wonderful, strange</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">marvellous thing, a wonder, marvel, miracle; wonderfulness, marvellousness</hi> (class.; syn.: prodigium, portentum): miracula, quae nunc digna admiratione dicimus, antiqui in rebus turpibus utebantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">portenta et miracula philosophorum somniantium,</quote> <trans><tr>strange and wonderful imaginations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
