D. 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adiciunt miracula huic pugnae,</quote> <trans><tr>relate wonderful things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse miraculo,</quote> <trans><tr>to be wonderful, to excite wonder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor digna miraculo,</quote> <trans><tr>singular, curious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quae miracula, dixit, Verteris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia transformat sese in miracula rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miraculum magnitudinis,</quote> <trans><tr>extraordinary size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euander ... venerabilis vir miraculo litterarum, rei novae inter rudes artium homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mors ejus majori miraculo fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miracula septem,</quote> <trans><tr>the seven wonders of the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29219.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a miracle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facientes pene incredibilia miracula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus miraculis plurimi allicientur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit quasi miraculum Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: nihil posse confingi miraculorum atque vitiorum, quod non ibi (in deorum genere) reperiatur, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 27.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrācŭlō</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">qaumastw=s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">wonderfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mirandus: <entryFree id="n29220" type="main" key="mi_randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. miror <sense id="n29220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
miratio: <entryFree id="n29221" type="hapax" key="mi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>miror</etym>, <sense id="n29221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wonder, admiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirationem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:22:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 22, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mirator: <entryFree id="n29222" type="main" key="mi_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an admirer</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">formae honestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 640</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miratrix: <entryFree id="n29223" type="main" key="mi_ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mirator</etym>, <sense id="n29223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wondering, admiring; she that wonders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">admires</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">miratrix turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 742" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 655</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
mire: <entryFree id="n29224" type="main" key="mi_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mirus <sense id="n29224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mirifice: <entryFree id="n29225" type="main" key="mi_ri^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mirificus <sense id="n29225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <pb n="1149" /> <cb n="MIRO" /></sense></entryFree>
mirificentia: <entryFree id="n29226" type="main" key="mi_ri^fi^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrĭfĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mirificus</etym>, <sense id="n29226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wonder, admiration</hi> (eccl. Lat.): mirabilium, Chrys. Serm. 63.</sense></entryFree>
mirifico: <entryFree id="n29227" type="main" key="mi_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exalt, make wonderful, magnify</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mirifica misericordias tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mirificus: <entryFree id="n29228" type="main" key="mi_ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mirus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n29228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing wonder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">admiration, wonderful, marvellous, extraordinary, singular, strange</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29228.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">voramus litteras cum homine mirifico ... Dionysio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in doctrinis mirificus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29228.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">turris mirificis operibus exstructa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirificas gratias agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed te mirificam in latebram conjecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 20, 47</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, in two forms: <cit><quote lang="la">mirificissimum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: mirificentissima potentia, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 42 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrĭfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wonderfully, marvellously, extraordinarily, exceedingly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">delectari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 8, 44, § 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mirimodis: <entryFree id="n29229" type="main" key="mi_ri^mo^di_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrĭmŏdīs</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>mirus-modus; cf. multimodis; v. Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 98</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n29229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in an astonishing manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium mirimodis mirabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mirio: <entryFree id="n29230" type="main" key="mi_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mirus</etym>. * <sense id="n29230.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A singularly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defectively formed person</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 64</bibl> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n29230.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wonderer, admirer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mirmillo: <entryFree id="n29231" type="main" key="mirmillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mirmillo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murmillo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">myrmillo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mormu/los</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of gladiator that used to fight with a Thracian</hi> (Threx), or <hi rend="ital">a net-fighter</hi> (retiarius), <hi rend="ital">and wore a Gallic helmet, with the image of a fish for a crest</hi> (whence the name): <cit><quote lang="la">retiario pugnanti adversus mirmillonem cantatur: Non te peto, piscem peto, quid me fugis, Galle? quia mirmillonicum genus armaturae Gallicum est, ipsique mirmillones ante Galli appellabantur, in quorum galeis piscis effigies inerat, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. retiario, p. 284 and 285 Müll.: ille autem ex myrmillone dux, ex gladiatore imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 4, 10</bibl>; 6, 7, 13; 12, 8, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 6, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 334, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 25, 66</bibl>; Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arval. p. 165, 1.</sense></entryFree>
mirmillonicus: <entryFree id="n29232" type="main" key="mirmillo_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mirmillōnĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">myrm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mirmillo</etym>, <sense id="n29232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> mirmillo: genus armaturae, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> mirmillones, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. retiario, p. 284 and 285 Müll.; v. mirmillo: myrmillonica scuta dicebant, cum quibus de muro pugnabant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miro: <entryFree id="n29233" type="main" key="mi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n29233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to wonder</hi> (ante-class. collat. form of miror): quid miras? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ambos mira aut noli mirare de eodem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si studium mirabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 474:25" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 474, 25</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 108 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n29233.1" n="2" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">miratā virginis arte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miror: <entryFree id="n29234" type="main" key="mi_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n29234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form, v. miro), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. smi, smile; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">meida/w</foreign>; cf.: mirus, nimīrum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to wonder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">marvel at, to be astonished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amazed at</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to admire;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc., acc.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">quod, si, quā ratione, quid, unde</hi>, etc., with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in Greek constr. also <hi rend="ital">aliquem alicujus rei</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29234.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentiam hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud jam mirari desino, quod ante mirabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa, tabulas pictas, vasa caelata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <trans><tr>to honor admiringly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:75" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia digna miratu,</quote> <trans><tr>of admiring wonder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:56" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari se,</quote> <trans><tr>to admire one's self, be in love with one's self, be vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29234.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis forte miratur, me ad accusandum descendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29234.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari se aiebat, quod non rideret haruspex, haruspicem cum vidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 24, 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29234.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idne tu miraris, si patrissat filius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: miror si, <hi rend="ital">I should wonder, be surprised, if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miror, in illā superbiā et importunitate si quemquam amicum habere potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <cb n="MISC" /> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne miremini, quā ratione hic tantum potuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus rei quae causa esset miratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miror, quid ex Piraeo abierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis mirari non possum, unde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis antea mirabatur, quid esset, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de singulari impudentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: ne quis miretur, cum tam clare tonuerit, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 3</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 4 Rib.).—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in Greek constr. (<foreign lang="greek">qauma/zw tina/ tinos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">aliquem alicujus rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(te) justitiaene prius mirer belline laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29234.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29234.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To have a regard for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritates ... amantium nos amicorum et nostra mirantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29234.7" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. subjects (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(arbos) miraturque novas frondes et non sua poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 82</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīran-dus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., wonderful, strange, singular</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in mirandam altitudinem depressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirandum in modum,</quote> <trans><tr>in a wonderful manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cliens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:161" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: mirandum est, unde, etc., <hi rend="ital">the wonder is</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mirus: <entryFree id="n29235" type="main" key="mi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. smi; v. miror</etym>, <sense id="n29235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wonderful, marvellous, astonishing, extraordinary</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mirum et magnum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum me desiderium tenet urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miris modis odisse aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>wonderfully, exceedingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 104</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">miris modis, adverbially,</quote> <trans><tr>wonderfully, strangely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum in modum conversae sunt hominum mentes,</quote> <trans><tr>astonishingly, surprisingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi mirum videri, quid in suā Galliā populo Romano negotii esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—With a foll. <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime mirum, si ista res, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mirum in senibus, si infirmi sunt aliquando?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: mirum quam or quantum, <hi rend="ital">it is wonderful how, how very, how much</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">extraordinarily, exceedingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum quam inimicus ibat, ut ego objurgarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, mirum quantum profuit ad concordiam civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mirum ut: mirum dictu, ut sit omnis Sarmatarum virtus velut extra ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: mirum ni or nisi, <hi rend="ital">it would be wonderful, I should wonder, I am very much mistaken, if not</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">most probably, undoubtedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira sunt, nisi invitavit sese in cena plusculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira sunt ni Pseudulust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 19</bibl> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">socer, et medicus me insanire aiebant: quid sit, mira sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>I wonder what it means, it is incomprehensible to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 56</bibl></cit>: mirum ni or quin, <hi rend="ital">undoubtedly, certainly</hi>: quid ploras pater? Mirum ni cantem: condemnatus sum, <hi rend="ital">I wonder I don't sing, of course I ought to sing</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 278</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum, quin ab avo ejus, aut proavo acciperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum quin te advorsus dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mirum?</quote> <trans><tr>what wonder?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 110</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, only ante-class.: mirior inquam tibi videor, Titin. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.: quid hoc mirius? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 135, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">wonders, marvels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia mira memoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem mira,</quote> <trans><tr>the seven wonders of the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wonderfully, marvellously, strangely, uncommonly, exceedingly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">puero municipia mire favent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factus canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 24</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">noun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mire opifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mire quam illius loci cogitatio delectat,</quote> <trans><tr>extraordinarily, exceedingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit> (al. mire quantum).</sense></entryFree>
mis: <entryFree id="n29236" type="main" key="mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mis</orth>, an archaic form for meis; v. meus <sense id="n29236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
misagenes: <entryFree id="n29237" type="main" key="Mi_sa^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīsăgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Masinissa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:62" default="NO" valid="yes">62</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
misargyrides: <entryFree id="n29238" type="main" key="Mi_sargy^ri^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīsargyrĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">misarguria</foreign>, <sense id="n29238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">money-hater</hi>, a name comically formed by Plautus to signify <hi rend="ital">usurer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miscellaneus: <entryFree id="n29239" type="main" key="miscella_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscellānĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">miscill-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>miscellus</etym>, <sense id="n29239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed, miscellaneous</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans><tr>of all sorts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 129 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n29239.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">miscellānĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <cb n="MISC" /> <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n29239.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hash of different sorts of broken meat, a gallimaufry, hodge-podge</hi>, the coarse diet of gladiators, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29239.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A writing on miscellaneous subjects</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Miscellanea Ptolemaei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miscelliones: <entryFree id="n29240" type="gloss" key="miscelli^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscellĭōnes</orth> <itype>appellantur, qui non certae sunt sententiae, sed variorum mixtorumque judiciorum sunt</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
miscellus: <entryFree id="n29241" type="main" key="miscellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscellus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">miscillus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 997</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>misceo</etym>, <sense id="n29241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (i. e. of tame and wild pigeons),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>composed of games of several kinds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl></cit>: aes, <hi rend="ital">a brazen tablet on which were inscribed the names of soldiers who had served out their time and to whom lands were assigned, and of those who succeeded to the place of others deceased</hi>, Sicul. Fl. de Condit. Agror. p. 23 Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 913</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">§ 997</bibl> Kopp ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
misceo: <entryFree id="n29242" type="main" key="misce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscĕo</orth>, <itype>miscŭi, mixtum</itype> (mistum is found in many MSS. and edd., but is probably a corruption of copyists, representing the weakened sound of <sense id="n29242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">x</hi> in later times; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 556), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root mik-, mig-; Sanscr. micras, mixed; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mi/sgw, mi/gnumi</foreign>; cf. miscellus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to mix, mingle, to intermingle, blend</hi> (for the difference between this word and temperare, v. below, II. A.; cf. confundo). </sense><sense id="n29242.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29242.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.; with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sortes) pueri manu miscentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toxicum antidoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella Falerno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina Surrentina faece Falernā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectare aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 198</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce amarumque mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletum cruori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter curalium virides miscere smaragdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 805</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumque meis lacrimis miscuit usque suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29242.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29242.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To join one's self to, have carnal intercourse with</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus cum aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic se tibi misceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 866</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo misceri in Venerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem et genus,</quote> <trans><tr>to intermarry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29242.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mix, prepare</hi> a drink: <cit><quote lang="la">alteri miscere mulsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veientana mihi misces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:49:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lurida terribiles miscent aconita novercae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 147</bibl></cit>; cf.: miscenda Cum Styge vina bibas, = <hi rend="ital">you shall die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:321" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 321</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis aconita propinquis miscuit (Orestes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:219" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 219</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29242.6" n="3" level="3"> Miscere se, or misceri, <hi rend="ital">to mingle</hi> with others, <hi rend="ital">to unite, assemble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscet (se) viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se partibus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 86, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa ad praetoria densae Miscentur,</quote> <trans><tr>assemble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29242.7" n="4" level="3"> Miscere manus or proelia, <hi rend="ital">to join battle, engage</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">miscere manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>to inflict wounds on each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 720</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29242.8" n="5" level="3"> Of storms, <hi rend="ital">to throw into confusion, to disturb, confound, embroil</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum terramque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno misceri murmure pontum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscent se maria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 714</bibl></cit>.—Hence, of persons, <hi rend="ital">to raise a great commotion, make a prodigious disturbance, to move heaven and earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum ac terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis caelum terris non misceat et mare caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare caelo confundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 282</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29242.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29242.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to mix, mingle, unite</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce amarumque una nunc misces mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: miscent inter sese inimicitiam agitantes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 275 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">animum alicujus cum suo miscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitate mixtus lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misce Ergo aliquid de nostris moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:322" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex dissimillimis rebus misceri et temperari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, joined with temperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:197" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 58, 197</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also opp. to temperare, since miscere signifies merely to mix, but temperare to mix in due proportion: haec ita mixta fuerunt, ut temperata nullo fuerint modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29242.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29242.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To share with, impart to</hi> another; <hi rend="ital">to take part in, share in</hi> a thing (rare and perhaps not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum amico omnes curas, omnes cogitationes tuas misce,</quote> <trans><tr>share</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se negotiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to take part in, engage in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:39:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 39, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:17:section=5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27, 1, 17, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternae hereditati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:42:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 2, 42, § 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29242.13" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 5.). </sense><sense id="n29242.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To throw into confusion, to embroil, disturb</hi> (class.): om <pb n="1150" /> <cb n="MISE" /> nia infima summis paria fecit, turbavit, miscuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam malis concionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum motus dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima, quae res humanas miscuit olim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:163" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 163</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29242.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stir up, occasion, excite, rouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego nova quaedam misceri et concitari mala jam pridem videbam,</quote> <trans><tr>stirred up, devised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n29242.16" n="3" level="3"> Misceri aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to be changed into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtus Enipeo Taenarius deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miscillaneus: <entryFree id="n29243" type="main" key="miscilla_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscillānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. miscellaneus.</entryFree>
miscillio: <entryFree id="n29244" type="main" key="miscilli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscillĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is undecided</hi> in opinion, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123, 7</bibl> Müll.; cf. miseix.</sense></entryFree>
miscillus: <entryFree id="n29245" type="main" key="miscillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. miscellus <sense id="n29245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
miscipulo: <entryFree id="n29246" type="gloss" key="miscipulo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscipulo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n29246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to smack</hi>: miscipulat, <foreign lang="greek">poppu/zei</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
miscitatus: <entryFree id="n29247" type="hapax" key="misci^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym><mood>Part.</mood> from the unused miscito, <hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> from misceo</etym>, <sense id="n29247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed, mingled</hi>, Auct. de Limit. p. 267 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
miscix: <entryFree id="n29248" type="hapax" key="miscix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">miscix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>misceo</etym>, <sense id="n29248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">changeable, inconstant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconstans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 6</bibl></cit> dub. (al. mittix).</sense></entryFree>
misellus: <entryFree id="n29249" type="main" key="mi^sellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [miser], <hi rend="ital">poor, wretched, unfortunate</hi> (rare, and with Cic. only in the epistolary style): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 23, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o miselle passer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wretch, miserable fellow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:213" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 213</bibl>.—Esp., applied to the dead: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alicujus defuncti recordaris, misellum vocas eum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. Anim. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 65</bibl>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">redactus sum usque ad hoc misellum pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1096" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1096</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
misenum: <entryFree id="n29250" type="main" key="Mi_se_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīsēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mishno/n</foreign>, <sense id="n29250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory, town, and harbor in Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Punta di Miseno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 13</bibl>; cf.: Misenum promontorium a Miseno tubicine Aeneae ibi sepulto est appellatum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Promontorium Misenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Miseni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> in the <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīsēna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29250.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīsēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n29250.2" n="1" level="3"> In fable, <hi rend="ital">son of Æolus, a trumpeter of Æneas, buried at the promontory of Misenum, whence it received its name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:162 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 162 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18</bibl> (4, 17), 3; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n29250.3" n="2" level="3"> For Misenum; v. above.—</sense><sense id="n29250.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mī-sēnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Misenum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29250.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīsēnātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Misenum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29250.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mīsēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. mons), <hi rend="ital">the promontory of Misenum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mons) qui nunc Misenus ab illo dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 234</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miser: <entryFree id="n29251" type="main" key="mi^ser"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭser</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prob. Sanscr. root mi-; cf. minuo; akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mi=sos</foreign>; Lat. maestus, maereo</etym>, <sense id="n29251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wretched, unfortunate, miserable, pitiable, lamentable</hi>, etc. (cf.: infelix, calamitosus). </sense><sense id="n29251.1" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam miserabile, quam ex beato miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo miser, et infortunatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miser atque infelix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgeris multis miser undique curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1051" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1051</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o multo miserior Dolabella, quam ille, quem tu miserrimum esse voluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miser, infelix, aerumnosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserrimum habere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to torment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserrimus Fui fugitando,</quote> <trans><tr>have exhausted myself with running, am completely tired out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseros ambitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:58:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 58, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29251.2" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">afflicting, sad, wretched, melancholy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserā ambitione laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misera orbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misera et calamitosa res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29251.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sick, ill, indisposed</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo morbo misera sum,</quote> <trans><tr>suffer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini misero non invideo medicinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illam miseram animi excrucias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo animo suo miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserum esse ex animo,</quote> <trans><tr>to be wretched in mind, sick at heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29251.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Violent, excessive, extravagant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus miser,</quote> <trans><tr>with regard to dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29251.5" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bad, vile, poor, worthless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 34</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: morum, Stat. <cb n="MISE" /> Th. 4, 403: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem perditum miserumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29251.6" n="6" level="3"> As an exclamation, inserted in the midst of a sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa atque pellis sum, misera, macritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: miserum! (parenthetically) i. e. <hi rend="ital">what a misfortune! how sad!</hi> tum pendere poenas Cecropidae jussi (miserum!) septena quotannis Corpora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 21</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕ-rum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wretched thing, wretchedness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum valetudo, miserum morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit> MSS. dub. (Madv. and B. and K. miser).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n29251.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wretchedly, miserably; desperately, vehemently, excessively, urgently</hi> (class.): est misere scriptum, Pseudole! <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> O miserrime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:15:501" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 15, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misere amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedere quaerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">misere cupis abire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut miserius a vobis recipiatur quam ab illo capta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misere miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misere male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29251.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wretchedly, lamentably, sadly</hi> (ante-class.; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): corrumpi, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 517, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 49</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P. (Vahl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 180</bibl>, n. 40).</sense></entryFree>
miserabilis: <entryFree id="n29252" type="main" key="mi^se^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>miseror</etym>, <sense id="n29252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of pity, pitiable, miserable, deplorable, lamentable, wretched, sad</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam miserabile, quam ex beato miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiet ultro miserabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:133" default="NO">9, 4, 133</bibl>: sisque miser semper; <cit><quote lang="la">nec sis miserabilis ulli, Ov. lb. 117: Irus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:77:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 77, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <trans><tr>plaintive, sad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegi,</quote> <trans><tr>mournful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserabilior causa mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrā-bĭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, for miserabiliter: <cit><quote lang="la">miserabile caesis insultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserabile longum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 65</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭ-sĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pitiably, lamentably, in a way to excite pity, mournfully, sadly, miserably</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">emori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta epistola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare,</quote> <trans><tr>to laud pathetically</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere tristia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:120" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac facie miserabilior Pollio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>: miserabilius dicere, Sen. Excerpt. Controv. praef. 4.</sense></entryFree>
miseramen: <entryFree id="n29253" type="hapax" key="mi^se^ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pity, commiseration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi miseramina panis (al. mihi fragmina panis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 285</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miserandus: <entryFree id="n29254" type="main" key="mi^se^randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. miseror <sense id="n29254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
miseranter: <entryFree id="n29255" type="main" key="mi^se^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. miseror <sense id="n29255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
miseratio: <entryFree id="n29256" type="main" key="mi^se^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>miseror</etym>, <sense id="n29256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pitying, pity, compassion, commiseration</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29256.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quādam miseratione delectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserationem commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseratione mens judicum permovenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 38, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserationem petere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to pray for pity and forgiveness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 10, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29256.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, rhetor., <hi rend="ital">a pathetic speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserationibus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem inclinat miseratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:23" default="NO">6, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:27" default="NO">4, 1, 27</bibl>; 4, 3, 15 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
miserator: <entryFree id="n29257" type="main" key="mi^se^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pities, a commiserator</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 295</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:85:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 85, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
misere: <entryFree id="n29258" type="main" key="mi^se^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. miser <sense id="n29258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
misereo: <entryFree id="n29259" type="main" key="mi^se^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕ-rĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus, 2</itype> (<sense id="n29259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> misererier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1023" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1023</bibl>; ante- and post-class. <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> misertus for miseritus, Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 58" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 58</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>miser</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to feel pity, have compassion, to pity, compassionate, commiserate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29259.1" n="I" level="1"> In the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form only ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n29259.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form misereo: <cit><quote lang="la">piaculumst miserere nos hominum rem male gerentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: miserete anuis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 30</bibl> (Trag. v. 232 Vahl.): cogebant hostes, ut misererent, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 824</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse sui miseret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 881</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29259.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form misereor (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">miseremini sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulat, ut sui misereantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: miserere temporis, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 1</bibl>: nescio qui nostri miseritus tandem deus, Afran. ap. Gell. <cb n="MISE" /> 20, 6, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">deos miseritos nominis Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum misereri mei debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborum tantorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserere mei, miserere meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserere inopum sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 89</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui Venus postea miserta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 58" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 294</bibl> P. —With <case>acc.</case> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">tot miserere animas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 440</bibl></cit> (al. miserare).—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut supplicum misereatur,</quote> <trans><tr>that we should feel pity for suppliants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29259.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: miseret and (less freq.) miseretur me alicujus and alicujus rei, <hi rend="ital">it distresses me, I feel pity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">compassion</hi> for a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n29259.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Form miseret: miseret me eādem formā dicitur, quā piget, poenitet, taedet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll.: tui me miseret, mei piget, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Trag. v. 82 Vahl.); cf.: quos non miseret neminis, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 174 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">miseret et aliorum, tui te nec miseret nec pudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum nos miseret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 34, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te mei tergi misereret, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nilne te miseret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29259.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Form miseretur, miseritum (misertum) est: patris me miseretur, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 477, 15</bibl>: neque me minus vestri quam mei miserebitur, L. Crassus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 824</bibl>: quando te nostrum et reipublicae miserebitur? Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:6:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave te fratrum pro fratris salute obsecrantium misereatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 14</bibl></cit>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P. (Klotz, misereat): <cit><quote lang="la">neque metui, neque tuorum liberum misereri potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 77</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ejus miseritum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: quo me reipublicae maxime misertum est, Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: miseretur tui, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 477, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
misereor: <entryFree id="n29260" type="main" key="mi^se^re^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus, 2</itype>, v. misereo.</entryFree>
miseresco: <entryFree id="n29261" type="main" key="mi^se^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n29261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [misereo]. </sense><sense id="n29261.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To feel pity, have compassion</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">his lacrimis vitam damus et miserescimus ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserescite regis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis miseresce tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:280" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 280</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29261.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: miserescit me alicu jus, <hi rend="ital">it distresses me, I feel pity, take compassion</hi> (cf. miseret, under misereo, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">inopis nunc te miserescat mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n29261.3" n="II" level="1"> I. q. miserum fieri, <hi rend="ital">to become wretched, miserable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid est homini miseriarum, quo miserescat miser ex animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miseret: <entryFree id="n29262" type="main" key="mi^se^ret"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕret</orth>, v. misereo, II.</entryFree>
miseretur: <entryFree id="n29263" type="main" key="mi^se^re_tur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrētur</orth>, v. misereo, II.</entryFree>
miserevivium: <entryFree id="n29264" type="main" key="mi^se^re^vi_vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĕvīvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n29264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> proserpinaca, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miseria: <entryFree id="n29265" type="main" key="mi^se^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>miser</etym>, <sense id="n29265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wretchedness, unhappy condition, misfortune, misery; affliction, distress</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n29265.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29265.2" n="A" level="2"> (Class.) Nam invidere alii bene esse, tibi male esse, miseriast, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 31</bibl>: Proloqui Caelo atque terrae Medeaï miserias, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl> (Trag. v. 292 Vahl.): quibus servitutem meā miseriā deprecor, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 290, 19</bibl> (Trag. v. 173 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">miserias voluptate sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi virtus est, ibi esse miseria et aerumna non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:32:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 32, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in miserias incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de miseriis in quibus versamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in miseriā esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oneri miseriaeque esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29265.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Trouble, fatigue, irksomeness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriam capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimiae miseriae est,</quote> <trans><tr>is too irksome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia est miseria nimis pulchrum esse hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (Stoici) omnia superstitiosā sollicitudine et miseriā crederent,</quote> <trans><tr>anxiety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriae plebis crescebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29265.4" n="II" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭsĕrĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Erebus and Nox</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
